1.content: Are you a boy or a girl?
1.title: Start!

choices: Straight into the Monster King's territory! (Are you nuts!?)
111.content:
MP: 100/100
Gold: 10
Inventory: Peasant clothes, wooden sword, wooden shield

You are a teenage boy, living in a remote village on the outskirts of the country. For years, you've had to watch monster boys harass your people. They would take the men as slaves, and take the women and impregnate them to birth more vile offspring. You've been practicing with a wooden sword and shield in your spare time, and you've grown slightly competent with their use. Today, you believe you are ready to begin your journey to slay the Monster King and his vile army of monster boys once and for all.

Where will you travel first?
111.title: Teen

choices: someone beckoning you into an alley...
An unusual glint on a rooftop.
1111.content: You may not be any city aristocrat or high-filluting high class guy, but you're smart enough not to go out unprepared. You travel to the nearest city, Antiuck. So cautious were you that you could be ambushed by smelly footed monstrosities that you hopped onto a neighbour's trading wagon to get into the city. Antiuck is a bustling market city full of back alleys and high rooftops, operating more as a mercantile city state that broke away from the kingdom than the average walled city, as such, the laws are more lax here. You hop off the wagon and go to start your business, you'll need better equipment and some training, and with 10 gold...it's a start. But that's when you notice...
1111.title: The closest city, for supplies.

choices: Sneak around the back and investigate.
Go to the Sisterhood, they should know their men are acting strange.
11111.content:
As you paced through the busy streets you couldn't help but notice the pendants men were wearing...shaped like a pair of feet. The church of the city was the "Sisterhood of Divine Protection", a church emphasizing that women should be in charge in order to protect men from joining the monstrous hordes. The last time you looked, their symbol was that of a female symbol on a shield. You stopped a man passing by and asked him about the necklace, he explained. "Oh this? Darling isn't it? The jeweler on Monty Street is giving them away!" The man then glanced at your boots for a second, before moving on with his day. What a creep.

In any case you need some money, maybe you could get one of them and pawn it off for gold? On the other hand, this seemed very unusual, it seemed all the men wearing these necklaces were giving odd untoward looks downwards...at each other's crotches...maybe their feet? You decide to investigate, you soon find the jeweler on Monty Street, there's a long line to getting a pendant.
11111.title: People wearing these strange pendants.

choices: You shop for your supplies, and return to the inn at the end of day.
You explore the city for a while, until you stumble on the dark part of town...
111111.content:
After a brief moment of thought, you decide to join the queue. The pendants were free, after all! In fact, they were probably worth a dozen or so gold coins to a travelling salesmen. Specially, with the current demand for foot-related items in New Solesville... I made you shudder, just wondering how an entire city could become so obsessed with feet overnight. Still, you had to admit: those foot-shaped necklaces weren't that bad. Quite beautiful, actually! Captivating, even... (-1 MP)

As you waited in line for your turn, you manage to hit up a conversation with the lanky young man behind you. His brand new clothes and puffed-up chest denounce him as a proud member of the petty bourgeoisie. "So, you're here to buy some supplies, eh?" he asks, a slight hint of disdain in his voice.

You nod enthusiastically, and reply with as much conviction as your heart could muster: "Yes. I've come here to buy some armour and training, and then I'm heading west, through the Crevices, to find and slay the Monster King!"

"Hehe..." the young man chuckles, clearly not impressed by your bravado. "Sure you are. Lots of adventurers come through here singing that song, you know? Funny how we don't hear from them again... still, if you're that much of a hero, you're better off fighting serpent-boys in the wild, then here in Antiuck!"

"How so?" you ask with morbid curiosity, the pain from your damaged ego immediately obscured by the man's cryptic statement.

"Well, let's just say the Sisterhood doesn't like seeing men run around with armour over their shoulders and weapons around their waist. They say it's for our protection, of course, but they're really just projecting their daddy issues onto us, law-abiding citizens. I will be damned if those lesbian fanatics think we actually care for any of their sanctimonious bullshit! My suggestion: if they tell you to do something, just nod quietly and piss off.

Besides... I hear there's rumours of something brewing down in the sewers. Something big. A revolution, maybe. Don't have a clue who's behind it yet, but I, for one, would gladly welcome the change of airs."

You're about to press the bourgeois for more information, when you hear a lisped, high-pitch voice calling: "Next!" You turn around to see you've finally reached the start of the queue, and are now standing before a large velvet table, lined with a hundred foot-shaped pendants. And behind the table sits a sickly young woman, her pale blue eyes staring right into yours as you feel her cold dead hands reach out to measure your neck. When she opens her mouth to talk, you swear you can feel the smell of cheese emanating from her throat... (-1 MP)

"Here you go, sire." she says, fitting a silver pendant encrusted with a polished malachite foot tightly around your neck. And as the necklace clicks into place, and you look into the exquisite pendant shining in your chest, right above your heart, all your doubts about their legitimacy fade away instantly (-3 MP). You walk away from the jeweller with an unprecedented sense of satisfaction and excitement, to the point of feeling a bit light-headed in the sun...

You lean against the wall of a nearby tavern, so as to catch your breath, but what you see next only makes you gasp even harder: a procession of monks marches down the street, their feet clad in nothing but a pair of thin leather sandals! And without realising, your eyes are helplessly drawn to the monks' visibly dirty (and no doubt, sweaty) soles. (-5 MP) Suddenly, it didn't feel wrong or even weird to stare at other men's feet. Not when you understood how subtly rough and beautiful they looked... not when their toes felt so strangely appetising and seductive... not when their soles suddenly held such a mesmerising power over you... (-5 MP)

The monks finally disappear down the street and you're crash-landed back into reality. Looking around you, you can see you weren't the only one left hypnotised by the show of parading male soles: at least a few dozen other people, all wearing the same foot-shaped pendants as you, remained with their eyes stuck on the spot where a few seconds ago, a young monk had laid down his sweaty foot. And looking down, you could see that, much like your fellow necklace-wearers, you had unwittingly pitched a massive tent in your trousers...

Shaking your head clear and your cock limp, you decide to ignore this incident, and promptly resume your business here in the city.

Your MP: 85/100 (-5 MP ongoing while the necklace is equipped)
111111.title: Line up and get one!

choices: You just need sleep... that's it! Just a bit of sleep...
You need feet. His feet. NOW!
1111111.content:
You spend most of your day hunting for bargains, in and around the market square. As the day progresses, you regularly find yourself reminiscing about the morning's procession of sandalled monks, and their luscious, sweaty soles. (-5 MP) Thankfully for you, there are plenty more feet on display at the market: big feet, small feet, old feet, young feet, pretty feet, ugly feet, clean feet, dirty feet...

"Hmm... dirty feet!" you think to yourself as you catch sight of some young rascals washing their toes in a fountain. For a moment, you consider pledging your very own oral cleaning apparatus to help wash their feet, but the boys are too soon chased off by an angry Sisterhood guard, leaving you with nothing but lust and regret (-5 MP).

With the sheer amount of barefoot plebs around you, shopping quickly became a strenuous task, demanding all your attention and focus. Despite your newfound foot fetish, you manage to purchase a rusted iron sword dealing 2 damage per hit for 4 gold, and bunch of dry lavender for 1 gold, to wear under your clothes and help mask unpleasant odours (even though your definition of 'unpleasant odour' was progressively shifting away from cheesy feet...)

Meanwhile, your initial idea to sell the pendant for a couple more coins was silently forgotten in between gawking at other people's lower extremities, and thinking of clever ways to convince merchants to sell you their worn shoes. Not that money was useless... but, as strange as it sounded, you felt a kind of emotional attachment to the necklace. You felt a warmth throughout your body you had only experienced once before in your life - the first time you had ever fallen in love. You just loved the pendant, and loved feet. Specially feet. (-5 MP)

And after a long day's perving, your legs automatically found their way to the nearest inn, ever so ironically called "The Rabbit's Paw". As your stepped through the door, a chubby little woman rushed to welcome you into her establishment and present you with usual array of food and drink. Since toejam wasn't on the menu, you decided to ask for a beer. And another one. And another one... quite a few, actually. By the end of the night, the alcohol had done its part chipping away at your self-consciousness. (-5 MP)

After that, it didn't take long for you to try and have a taste of your drinking buddy's toes, before being triumphantly kicked and punched up the stairs, and toward your room. As you leaned on the doorframe, wiping the blood off your swollen lip, your eyes wander to the end of the corridor, where you saw a young gentleman of exotic descent, no doubt a Far-Southerner by his tanned skin, pitch-black hair and deep-blue eyes, slowly enter his bedroom. Your eyes bulge along with your nether regions as you look down to his shapely feet, encased in nothing but an exquisite leather sandal!

In your drunken stupor, the thought of storming into the young man's room and taking your frustration out on his soles does cross your mind... on the other hand, you had barely escaped alive minutes ago from a similar exploit. Oh, god...

Your MP: 65/100 MP (-5 MP ongoing while the necklace is equipped)
1111111.title: Shopping for supplies

choices: Ignore His words, and try to focus on what happened...
11111111.content:
In an ultimate feat of willpower, you tear your gaze from the young man's feet and stumble loosely into your room. As you fall face flat on the bed, the drunken vision of a glorious pair of smelly soles flies through your mind, but it quickly dissolves as a relentless tide of sleep washes over you. You hold your trusty pendant between your fingers one last time, before falling into a deep, dreamful slumber... (-5 MP)

*****
A foul smell permeated your nostrils. Even if you were conscious, you could barely describe its pungent perfection; but you transfixed by it. The smell, the wonderful cheesy smell, was all you saw. It was like a dense fog, swirling and twirling within your mind, leading you deeper... and deeper... and deeper... into nowhere. You were falling, and all you could hear was the rancid mist, rushing past your ears, singing, speaking... and as you fell into a sleeping trance, you could finally hear His words.

Ever close, my Stench draws near...
Smell it: your purpose is clear.

With eager hands you reclaim
what faithless minds thought profane...

And at my Soles do you toil,
for the Feet which rule your soil...

His verses echoed through your mind, and your body. You could feel them inside you. As the smelly fog seeped into you, so did His words.

You took a deep, deep breath... in your lungs, the stench formed into an image. And that image was the most beautiful pair of feet you had ever seen: giant creamy soles, their enormous arch hanging over you, dripping drop after drop of sweat from their perfect, round toes; you were fascinated, mesmerized... you pressed your hands into the warm, smooth flesh... you rubbed it with all your strength... all your effort... all your love. You worshipped His Feet, as you knew you should.

You planted a single, delicate kiss on the divine arches before you. The sight, the taste, the scent... it overwhelmed you. You were in complete hypnotic ecstasy. And you weren't alone... you were together at His Feet... the Feet for whom you toiled... the Feet which ruled your soil. (-25 MP)

*****
You wake up in your bed, a few minutes before sunrise. Your clothes are wet, smelling of sewage and sweat. Your muscles hurt, as if you had been exercising all night long. For a moment, you wonder what happened. But then, His words echo through your brain: "Ever close, my Stench draws near..." You couldn't understand what they meant... yet you could hear them. Again and again... and the more you heard, the harder it was to think about anything else...

Your MP: 35/100 MP (-5 MP ongoing while the necklace is equipped, -25 MP every night)
11111111.title: The Dreamstride of the Monster King

choices: Your necklace, she rips it off it's cord!
Her blade, she thinks your a inflitrator!

You shake your head, calwing off the sweaty clothes and slipped on something clean. Without even casting a glance at your sandals, you opened the door and walked out into town, your bare feet on display.

As you walked through town, you saw that almost all the town's people had forgon footwear like you, exept for the Sisterhood.Your eyes were on other people's feet, daydreaming about their smell and feel in your hands as you massaged them. (-5 MP)

"Oof!" you hear as you collide with someone you look up, seeing a Sisterhood member with a large emblem on her arm, a veteran captain "Watch were your going!"

"Sorry ma'am!" you exclamed getting up quickly "I wasn't looking!"

"No-nothing" you stutter out, making the captain narrow her eyes

"Nothing, hm?" she asks mockingly, before placing her palm on your head as a white glow emminated from it. You gulped as you saw the spell, an extremely powerfull truth enchantment, that would make say nothing but the truth for an hour. Your irises changed to white as the spell took hold. "Now I'll ask again, what where you looking at?"

"People's feet" you say, unnable to fight the spells effects, though it felt oddly liberating to say it out loud

"Why?" she asks, looking you over as if searching fo monster traits

"Becuase I like them" you say

"Since when?" she asks, her eyes on your neck

"Since yesterday at the market" you explain, curios as to why she's staring at the spot with you beloved necklace. She frowns and reches for...

"Hey!" you yell as she takes your most valuble possesion "Give that back!" insted of answering you, she threw the chrm to the ground and stomped on it, shattering it "No!" you yell collapsing to your knees, grabbing the shattered pieces of your necklace. As soon as you touch it, a white smoke emminated from it and flew into your nose, making your mind seem sharper than it's been for a whole day (45 MP restored)

"There, you alright" the captain asked, crouching next to you "I've seen people go into a coma after those are shattered"

"Yeah, I'm alright" you say, your complete and mindless infatuation with feet began to diminish sligltly "What was that thing?"

"Their called Pedes Orbis" she said venomously "Thier made by monster boys to hypnotize and soften up people before they come in for the catch, where did you get it?"

"The jewler on Monty Street" you say, the truth spell still in effect

"Monty Street?" she repeated, to which you nod "There has never been a jewler there!" she grabbed your shoulders stood up "Listen to me, alright?" you nod "You need to get out of the town, now!"

"Why?" you ask

"Monsters send thralls to sell these charms when their planning to siege a town" the captain explained, unhooking her sword from her belt "Here, take this"

"What, no you need it!" you exclaim "If monsters are going to try and take over-"

"I have another one. Your gonna need it" she said serously "Those charms leave a trace on you. The monster who started this is going to be able to track you. And you'll have a stronger scent to other ones, this blade can do a lot more damage to them. Still haven't seen a monster that can survive a hit from it" you nod and hook the blade to your belt

(You recieve the Monstrum Interfectorem. This enchanted blade does extra 10 points of damage to monster boys)

You stand up and run back to the inn, rushing into your room and quickly packing everything into your bag. You grabbed your boots and unhappily force them on, you see the effects of the Pedes Orbis are still affecting you. You run to the inn's bar and quickly buy some food to go and run out the door.

Halfway through Mony Street, you stop for a quick breather and see the Sisterhood members rushing around, reading weapons. Taking a big breath you start running towards the town gate, but you heard a strage rumbuling coming from underground, you stop and see a nerby sewer grate, shake as if someone on the other side was opening it.

111112.content:
This is all too suspicious! Without the presence of the Royal Guard, the chances of monster infiltration and activity to be even more likely. You decide to sneak around the blacksmith, luckily due to the smelting they had to keep windows open to ventilate, so there was plenty of avenue to peek into the shady operation. It was high up though, it takes some effort for you to climb up a rooftop and onto the window. What you saw was shocking!

Two men were hard at work, one was the local blacksmith, tirelessly striking and smelting new metal to create pendants and melting down ore by the bucketful...how many pendants were they planning to make?! The young hulking man cut out smaller pieces and passed them to his smaller partner. You watch the partner carve them out into the foot shapes and hooks them through thin chains. They're working so hard, they're sweating profusely and they're barefoot! Among the sulfur smell and humid air is a light smell of feet. (-1 MP) The jeweler places down his sculpted pendants and that's when he shows up...a fairy! He hovers down, must only be half a foot tall, but you can see a shimmering dust covering his feet. He speaks to the boys, who are fixated in their work. "That's right! So many to make! And every second they're around a neck, the more they drain away their will...and replace it with a very smelly obsession!" The fairy cackles, the boys drone in agreement. The fairy dusts the pendants with some magic before getting the jeweler to hand them out...it's a plot to brainwash the town's men!

You have (99 Mp)
111112.title: Sneak around the back and investigate.

choices: The fairy makes his slaves fight you!
The fairy uses his fairy dust on you!
1111123.content:
As you watched the horrible scene play out, you didn't notice that the heat emitting from the workshop was getting to you. It made your palms sweaty; too sweaty to keep your grip on the window sill. He takes you by the hand and leads you through the streets. You eventually end up at a pink, five story building. Outside stands a Goblin boy who greets you with a wave. "This is the House of Temptation. It's a pretty big attraction around here, believe it or not. Basically, they'll give you money if you can resist being seduced!"


You raise an eyebrow at the fox boy. "What's the catch?" You ask.


He chuckles, "oh right! If you lose, they enslave you. All you have to do is make it through five monster boys! One per floor! There's several on each floor, separated by types! You get to choose! The workers are usually volunteers. Heck, I've volunteered once or twice!"


"Why the hell would I want to do that? I'm a Hero, not a whore!" You shout defensively.


"Well the entire objective is to NOT have sex. You lose by whipping your dick out, after all. Also, the town's military is pretty strong. They don't usually have any quests that need doing. You might be able to scrounge one up, but it'll be incredibly dangerous. Or you could roll up your sleeves and work with the blacksmith. I hear he's usually hiring. None of those offer a ten thousand coin payout though!"


Your eyes light up. Ten...thousand...gold? For NOT having sex with monsters? That's incredibly tempting...what do you do?


MP: 95/100
11133332322151511.title: You make it without incident

111333323221515111.content:
You think over the options in your head. The House of Temptation is no doubt the riskiest one... but it definitely has the highest payoff. That gold reward can buy you the highest-end equipment, and if you're careful with your spending, a life of luxury after your quest is over. Sure, failure means enslavement, but no matter what you do, you'll be working with monster boys, which usually results in enslavement regardless. You take a deep breath, stand up straight, and approach the goblin in front of the House.

"Greetings, human!" The goblin bows courteously. He's suspiciously polite for a monster, and especially polite for a goblin. "How gracious of your master to bring you here!" You want to correct him, but there's no telling what would happen if you blew your cover. You grit your teeth and bear the humiliation. "So, you want to enter the House of Temptation, huh?"

"Yes, I would," you answer.

"Fantastic!" The goblin's grin stretches from ear to ear. "Now, I'm sure your master taught you the rules of the House, but a refresher never hurts: there are five floors of the house, each with a selection of monsters behind closed doors. Simply make it past the monsters without being seduced, and after you clear the fifth floor, a cache of ten-thousand gold coins is waiting for you! Fall to temptation at any time, and the monster that bests you is your new owner, free to do with you as they see it. One more thing: the doors lock when you enter, so it's do or die in there! Do you still wish to enter?"

"Yes," you answer again, annoyed that you had to sit through that explanation you already had less than a minute ago.

"Great! Now, just one more thing before you go..." The goblin whips out a bottle of perfume, and before you can react, blows a cloud of blue mist into your face. The bitter taste and scent causes you to cough and your eyes water, but your senses feel as sharp as ever. (MP MAX)

"Just a little brain refresher. Trust me, you'll want all the wits you can get in there!" You grab Kusai's arm and prepare to walk through the door, but the goblin stops you before you can enter. "Ah ah, no bringing along your master! You have to take on this challenge alone." You look to Kusai's face with worry, but he merely chuckles. "You'll be fine in there. At least, you better be. I don't want my slave taken from me so easily!" He sticks out his tongue and winks at you.

You shakily push the door open without your kitsune companion in tow. You enter an unlit room, with the only source of light being the sun behind you. The door creaks shut, leaving you in total darkness. You hear a click behind you, which you assume is the door locking shut.

After a few tense moments, a candelabra above you magically flickers to life, illuminating the room. There's little in the way of decor: just the candelabra and three wooden doors before you. Examining the doors, you see they all have wooden placards above them with figures carved in. You assume these tell you what monster lies beyond the door. The left door has a mouse. The middle door has a raccoon. The right door... well, you can't really make out what's above that one. It seems someone intentionally scratched out any image it had before.

Which door do you choose?

MP: 100/100
111333323221515111.title: Enter the House of Temptation

1113333232215151111.content:
As you push open the wooden door, you feast your eyes upon the room before you. It's composed of just basic wooden floorboards with matching wood paneling going up the walls. More notably, however, are the numerous articles of footwear. Dirty socks, well-worn shoes, and sandals with deeply-embedded footprints littered the room so densely that you couldn't possibly take a step without stepping over at least item. It doesn't help that all these used shoes and socks combine to give the room an odor of stale footsweat. The stench snakes its way up your nose, and while it's hardly enough to floor you, especially in comparison to what Kusai put you through, but it's still rather unpleasant and makes you scrunch up your face. (-5 MP)

At the center of the room stands the mouse boy you expected to see. He's short and lithe, only coming up to about your chest in height. Light grey fur covers his body, only stopping at his wrist and ankles, leaving his pink hands and feet bare. A mop of medium-length black hair lays scattered atop his head, his bangs just above his bright blue spectacled eyes. The only article of clothing he's wearing is a tight, white pair of underwear, accentuating his above-average bulge. His whiskers and pink nose twitch in excitement as he sees you step through the door.

"Ah, welcome, traveler, to the House of Temptation! I am Rodello, and I shall proctor your first trial!" His smile seems genuine, but you can detect a glimmer of eager malice behind his sparkling eyes. "Your objective is simple: you only have to get to the door on the other side of the room. There are no hidden traps, the room is exactly as you perceive it. You may take as long as you need. I will stand here and not physically impede you in any way. You only fail if you concede or otherwise are unable to continue."

You arch an eyebrow. Sure, this might just be the first floor, but there's no way this rat's about to let you pass this easily. "What's the catch?" you ask, hoping you won't regret your words.

Rodello's smile transformed into a bitter smirk. "Oh, I'm glad you asked..." He closes his eyes for a moment, and when they open back up, they're glowing purple behind his glasses. He begins chanting in a language completely unknown to you, and after a few seconds, the words begin to give you a throbbing headache. You move your hands to grip your head, but discover your hands have disappeared beneath your sleeves... and it seems your head is about to retreat beneath your collar! By some arcane force, you're shrinking right out of your clothes! You try to get moving, but you trip over your pant leg, falling flat on your face.

Quickly, you climb out of the pile of your clothes just as the shrinking stops. Suddenly, the room is no longer a short stroll from one end to the other. To your inch-high body, it's a vast landscape with mountains of cotton, silk, and leather. And the smell... gods, the smell! It was unpleasant at full-size, but now that you're tiny, forcing you to be at ground-level, where their rancid fog lingers, it's downright toxic! (-10 MP)

Rodello's squeaky voice booms high above you, echoing off the walls and shaking you to the core. "You see, us mice are weak and typically low on the hierarchy. Even among my brothers and sisters, I was the runt of the litter... but I found myself with a gift: supernatural attunement to the magical arts. I've brought dozens of humans to knee with just a simple charm spell whispered in their ears... and I would've done the same with you, had not the rules of this establishment forced me to give you a fighting chance!"

This puny monster, a powerful mage? You would've scoffed at the idea, but here you are, standing nude in a pile of your own clothes. You grit your teeth and leap down to the wooden planks. You swiftly dart forward, knowing that, despite what the mouse boy said, you are on a strict time limit. Sooner or later, the noxious odor of feet surrounding you is going to warp your mind and make you comatose with lust, and your only hope is to escape as quickly as possible.

As you rush past piles of footwear and socks, you come across a pair of blue satin slippers. The stench around them is highly concentrated; just a single whiff forces you to stop running and start coughing. Despite your viscerally negative reaction, your cock instantly becomes stiff!

Rodello's ears pique up as he hears your hacking fit. "Found my favorite pair of slippers, have you? Ah, how I love roasting my toes in their warm embrace with my feet by the fire as I pore over my tomes. Countless nights have those slippers wrapped my sweaty feet, and never once have they been washed. Perhaps you'd like to join my feet in them after you concede, hmm?" (-10 MP)

You shake off the mouse's taunts and stumble away from the slippers. You shudder at the thought of being roasted under his hot, sweaty feet for hours on end, and yet, your cock twitches eagerly... you have to get out of here before it's too late!

After a minute of sprinting, you begin to notice something odd about the footwear strewn about. From above, it looked as if they were thrown around haphazardly. But now, being among them, you're starting to think they were placed around very deliberately. Then it hit you: every turn you took from the center of the room, where you would eventually run into Rodello, eventually made you veer right back. Clearly, he wants you to run past his feet, and he's certainly planning something when you do...

When you draw closer to the halfway point, you're unfortunately proven correct: all along his left and right side is a wall of smelly socks. Even if you crawled along the edge of the room the entire time, you would've faced the same hazard. They're not insurmountable, but time is of the essence. You look up to Rodello's gargantuan visage. The shine of his glasses prevents you from seeing his eyes, but his smug smirk is all too clear. He's got you right where he wants you.

Not wanting to waste even more precious seconds fretting on your decision, you start moving on instinct, going towards...

MP: 75/100
1113333232215151111.title: The left door (mouse boy)

choices: Sit and drink with the tanuki.
Sit with the tanuki, but decline the sake.
Don't go with his games! Fight him for the key!
1113333232215151112.content:
You assess your options. The left door likely has a mouse boy. Normally, they would be docile enough to slip past without much trouble, but if it happens to be mating season, they're horny enough to fuck the first hole they see... and you don't want it to be yours. Meanwhile, the right door could be literally anything.

That leaves the middle door, and there's only one type of monster you can associate with raccoons: the tanuki. Tanukis are known to be fairly docile as far as monsters go, and even amicable at times. Many are content to live out their days as traders and are easily able to flit between human and monster settlements with their shapeshifting powers. It's widely believed that about one in three humans have interacted with a tanuki at some point in their life, whether they know it or not.

You decide that dealing with a tanuki would be the safest option and hope you can pass through with no trouble. You crack the door slightly ajar to see if you can take just one peek before barging in, but all you see is blackness. Regardless, you enter anyways. Just as when you entered, the door locked shut behind you and the lights flickered on, illuminating the room.

All of a sudden, you found yourself in a sauna! The air was hot and stuffy and vapor gathered around your ankles. The only furniture in the room was a sturdy looking bench contrast with a flimsy table in front of it. On that bench sat the tanuki. He was covered from head to toe with greyish-brown fur. He was a full head taller than you, and quite a bit girthier, but you've seen enough fighters to know that with his type of body, layers of muscle are bound to be beneath that fat. You can't tell if he's "old" or not- he looks like an average tanuki you'd see in an illustration- but he certainly has an air of maturity and wisdom beyond your years to him. He was wearing naught but a short bath towel, and beneath it you could spy... the hugest testicles you've ever seen! Each one had to be bigger than your fist! You've heard rumors of tanukis' virility, but this is almost cartoonish!

The tanuki gives you a friendly smile and a wave. Not exactly what you were expecting. Is he trying to lull you into a false sense of security? After an intense silence and a one-sided staredown, you finally speak up.

"So... what? Are you gonna try to seduce me?" you ask, trying to hide the anxiousness in your voice.

The tanuki softly chuckles. "My human-chasing days are long behind me, but if you're offering yourself..." You scowl at the suggestion.

"Then I can just walk through the door like that, and just be on my way?"

"Not so fast," the tanuki says, shaking his head. Looking closer, you see a key hanging from his neck by a cord. That must be the key to the door out of here. You sigh, knowing better than to think it would be so easy. "Alright then, what do I have to do to get that key, fight you for it?"

"Nothing so boorish," the tanuki says, frowning slightly. "I've been waiting here for hours with nary a soul in or out of my chambers. All I desire is some company for a few minutes, then you shall be on your way." He pats the bench to his left, beckoning you to sit. "Please, have a seat." He then gestures to the table, which has a bottle of sake with two clay shot glasses on it. "Have a drink as well, if you wish. And no, there's no footsweat or sleeping potion in it. Just famed tanuki-brewed sake." He pours himself a glass and drinks it himself as a show of good faith.

Something about this situation is highly suspicious. You just know the tanuki is up to something, but at the same time, you don't have very many options to get that key from him, either.

MP: 100/100
1113333232215151112.title: The middle door (tanuki)

11133332322151511121.content:
You don't like cozying up to someone who's job is to enslave you, but you like your odds of taking this tanuki in a fistfight even less. You awkwardly walk up to the tanuki and take a seat next to him. He happily pours a shot of sake and hands you the glass. You take a cursory sniff, and it smells just as you would expect alcohol to. "Kanpai!" the tanuki cheers before throwing back his own shot. You join him, throwing the sake down your throat...

...and promptly coughing and sputtering it back out. Heavens, that stuff is strong! Though you cough a lot of it back up, you still get enough into you to make the inside of your body feel as warm as the outside.

(New status effect: Tipsy. All MP losses are doubled!)

The tanuki can't help but uproariously laugh as you're sent into a coughing fit. "Can't handle your sake, huh?"

"I can handle it just fine! I was just... taken aback by the taste, is all!" you exclaim as you catch your breath.

"Bah, I've seen 'taken aback.' That was just the gullet of a young lad who hasn't learned to appreciate a fine liquor." The tanuki smiles smugly at you, obviously getting a kick out of your pathetic reaction.

"I've drank men three times my size under the table!" you blatantly lie, trying to save some face.

The tanuki cocks an eyebrow. "Is that so? Hmm, I have a little proposition for you, then: if you can outdrink me, you can take the key and leave as you please. If you drop before I do, you have to give my feet a little tonguebath while you're down there, then you can be on your way... if you can stand back up, that is." You take a look at his feet, and you can instantly tell he wasn't lying about being in here for hours: his hairy, dull-claw-tipped toes are absolutely glistening with sweat. (-10 MP)

You're not sure if the shot of sake, the damnable heat of the room, or your own pride is clouding your judgment, but you feel that this is a challenge you cannot back down from. "You're on!" you shout with machismo. You already feel regret in the pit of your stomach as you watch him pour the shot glasses, but there's no going back now...

MP: 90/100
Status: Tipsy
11133332322151511121.title: Sit and drink with the tanuki.

choices: Resist Kenta's advances and continue your quest!
Maybe he has a point... suck on his toe.
11133332322151511122.content:
You don't like cozying up to someone who's job is to enslave you, but you like your odds of taking this tanuki in a fistfight even less. You awkwardly walk up to the tanuki and take a seat next to him, but firmly decline the drink. "Suit yourself." He shrugs and takes another shot of sake.

Just as you get comfy in your seat, the tanuki places his feet on your lap! A cringe runs down your spine as his heel inadvertently caresses your cock. (-5 MP) You try to get up, but his powerful legs keep you forced in your seat. "You bastard!" you begin to cry out. "I knew I never should've-"

"Calm down," the tanuki interrupts in a soothing manner. "I am not forcing myself upon you. I merely request a... friendly foot rub while we speak. The management does not appreciate it when I merely let humans go without some sort of ...risque action."

If you could glare daggers, you'd see this monster pinned to the wall. Nevertheless, he continues. "Come, now. If you can't handle a little foot rub, you would have no hope of making it past the second floor, let alone the rest. Think of this as... practice." He does have a point. You assume it only gets worse the higher you climb. Perhaps you should be glad he's only asking for a foot rub... and hope it stays just a foot rub.

You sigh with resignation and begin rubbing, digging your thumbs into his padded, hairless soles. They're surprisingly soft for someone so well-traveled, and your thumbs easily sink into them. (-5 MP) Unfortunately, they're also quite a bit sweaty, as you would expect from someone having been in a sauna for so long. Squeezing his feet is akin to wringing out a damp sponge. Sweat cascades down his soles and across your hands. (-5 MP)

The tanuki sighs contently as you massage his feet. "Ahhh, much better. Now, I believe we are overdue for introductions. I am Kenta. And you are...?"

"...David."

"David! A pleasure to meet you. I would shake hands, but yours are a bit preoccupied." You are unamused with this attempt at humor and continue massaging in silence.

"Not one for words, are you?" Kenta asks. "Will you at least tell me why you're here?"

You're prepared to tell him you're here to strike it rich and defeat the Monster King, but it's probably safer to stick to your cover story. "I'm here to earn gold for my master and prove my worth and loyalty to him."

Kenta can hardly contain himself. "Pffffft, ahaha! Kusai, your master? That old fox? Come now, lad, tell me why you're really here."

You feel your heart drop and grit your teeth. "How... how do you know who Kusai is... and how do you know I'm traveling with him?"

Kenta merely continues laughing. "Me and him go way back. I'd always stop by his cave on my trading route, and he'd always want to sell me the most useless, gaudiest knickknacks I've ever seen at five times their worth! His damn silver tongue always got me to buy at least one, too. I'd curse the name if he wasn't such a good drinking buddy. As for how I know you're with him, why, I can recognize the stench of that fox anywhere! Now, c'mon, tell me why you're here."

You breathe sharply out your nose and look away from Kenta. "...I'm here to earn gold to buy equipment sufficient to slay the Monster King."

Kenta cocks a bushy eyebrow, bemused. "Oho! That old fox always talked about wanting to overthrow the King. Something about finding 'the human with the resolve to overcome the toughest odds.' I suppose if he's finally ventured out of that dusty cave, he must have found him in you. I only hope he placed his trust the right way... the odds do not get much tougher than in the House of Pleasures."

After a few more minutes of massaging and idle chit-chat, Kenta seems ready to let you go. "Alright then lad, I can tell you're eager to get going..." You try to get up, but his powerful legs keep you pinned down. "...but there's just one more thing I must ask. The monsters on the higher floors are not nearly as gentle as I am. If one of them enslaves you, you can expect a short life of intense cruelty with your mind, body, and soul shattered... if you're lucky." Kenta raises his right foot onto your shoulder, leaving his sole just inches from your face. The cheesy, musky odor of his foot washes over you, flooding your mind with forbidden thoughts. Just when you think you couldn't feel any hotter, the heat pouring from his sweaty foot as well as your flushed cheeks make you feel like you're about to melt! (-5 MP)

"Would you submit to me right now?" Kenta asks. "While I would be the dominant partner, we would be partners, at the very least. You will help me while I travel from city to city, trading with the locals. They will treat you with the same respect and dignity any trader deserves. You will be paid your fair share. When we are alone, you will have proper sleeping arrangements... and you may indulge in my feet from time to time. Don't think I didn't feel your growing erection while we spoke." Kenta punctuates his point by grabbing your shaft through your pants with his dexterous toes, causing you to bite your lip. (-5 MP)

"You are more than welcome to decline my offer. Just know it is the most generous you will receive in the House. Should you accept..." Kenta's right foot flexes forward, placing his big toe over your lips. You can feel your brain fizzle as the scent from between his toes wafts up your nose. (-5 MP)

"...part your lips, and accept my toe into your mouth as you accept your new lifestyle."

On one hand, his "generous" offer is ridiculous on its face. How can you defeat the Monster King while being a sidekick to a tanuki and being forced to worship his stupid sexy feet? On the other hand... Kenta has planted the seeds of doubt in your mind. Can you really resist the advances of four more monsters? Was Kusai right to place his trust in you? Perhaps this new lifestyle is where you really belong...

MP: 70/100
11133332322151511122.title: Sit with the tanuki, but decline the sake.

111333323221515111221.content:
Those smelly Tanuki toes are...oddly inviting. And he does seem more civil than most monsters you've met! However, there's no way you'll be able to defeat the Monster King if you just let him walk all over you. No matter how much you really, really want him to! To Kenta's surprise, you shake your head and scoot your seat backwards to get away from his feet.

"N-no!" You shout at the Tanuki. "I can't accept your offer. If I cave here, then Kusai's faith was entirely misplaced. N-not that I really care about his plans! Just...I certainly can't beat the Monster King if I can't beat five other monsters!"

Kenta gives a knowing smirk, but doesn't press the issue any further. "Very well. I suppose you've earned this." He says as he slides the key and string off his neck and tosses it to you. "I will warn you though. While I have no idea what floors two through four hold, as they change each floor's theme daily, I know that floor five's theme always stays the same."

"Oh?" You ask as the key flies into your grasp. "And what theme would that be?"

"High-Rank Monsters." The Tanuki replies. "The kind that smell so bad it could even poison you. Kitsune boys, Dragon boys, Incubi, even Skunk boys."

Your blood runs cold at the mentioning of each name. This place really is going to be hell, isn't it? Well, it's already too late to flee...so onward it is. You thank Kenta for the information, unlock the door, and head upstairs to another set of doors. Once again, there appears to be three options. You choose...
111333323221515111221.title: Resist Kenta's advances and continue your q...

1113333232215151112212.content:
Looking between the three doors, you find yourself fixated on the one with the small lizard on it. Surely this can't be all that bad, right? You walk in the door. The whole room is sparse and dirty...and there's a small green lizard boy in here. He's also sparsely clothed and dirty. His scaly feet are covered in a thin layer of dirt, and ugh! You can smell them from here! (-5 MP)


The little kobold gasps and runs up to you when he sees you enter. "Oh! Hi! Hiiii! People never come in my room! It's nice to meet you, human!" He bounces up and down excitedly. You have to admit it's pretty cute. The dirty lizard boy scampers around the room and pulls a chair up for each of you. "Sit please! Then I can explain my game!"


He takes a seat and looks at you expectantly. You don't really have the heart to refuse the little guy. You sit down and ask, "what's this game you mentioned?"


"The game! To get the key! Where you become my slave if I win!" He exclaims, getting more excited with every pause. "For this game, you have to find my shoes! But you can only use your nose!" He pulls out a blindfold and hands it to you. "If you can bring them back to me without sticking your nose in them and sniffing on purpose, you win!"

You take the blindfold from the kobold and stare at him. He can't be serious right now! "How am I supposed to know I've found them then? What if my nose gets in them when I'm trying to find them?"


"That's why I said on purpose, silly! You only lose if you sniff em after you've got em in your hands!" He ushers you to put the blindfold on. He's really excited about this it seems! With a sigh, you don the blindfold and start sniffing the air, trying to find his probably disgusting shoes.

MP: 65/100
1113333232215151112212.title: The middle door (Kobold)

11133332322151511122121.content:
You sniff and fumble around the room blindly, searching for the lizard's shoes. Sniff and sniff as you might, you have little luck. The entire room just smells like... feet. (-5 MP)

"I heard it's easier if you get down on your hands and knees!" the kobold shouts out. You don't know if he's mocking you or not, but he has a point either way. You get down on all fours and begin your search anew. Being down here like a mutt, intentionally looking for a smelly pair of shoes... it's all very humiliating.

You play hot-and-cold with your olfactory senses, going to where the smell of feet strengthens and adjusting course where it weakens. You start to think about the purpose of such a strange game. Could it be... you're being trained to follow the scent of feet? Is he trying to plant a subconscious trigger in your brain to make you seek out feet? You try not to put much thought into it. You're sure it'll take a lot more than that to make you lust for, to make you crave smelly, rancid, enticing feet.

You find a spot you're sure is close to the shoes, if the heavy stench is anything to judge by. You try to stop sniffing for your sanity's sake and feel around with your nose. After about thirty seconds of holding your breath, your nose bumps into something leathery. That's it! You're so excited to finally finish the challenge that you accidentally inhale in. The scent is just as leathery as the texture, and sour and cheesy to boot! (-10 MP)

You pause for a moment, stunned by the scent. It was foul and noxious, but as much as you hate to admit it, you kind of liked it... You could take another sniff, now that you have them, right? You haven't got them in your hands, and you still haven't smelled the insole. Besides, these could be a trap. Surely, you owe it another sniff, just to be absolutely sure these are what you're looking for. Even if you had a sniff with them in your hands, would it really be that bad being this kobold's slave? He seems really excited and upbeat. You're sure he would be a kind, caring master...

N-No! You shake the evil thoughts from your head. You will not be some stinky lizard's plaything! You rip the blindfold from your head, grab the shoes (taking care to hold them as far from your face as possible) and deliver them to the kobold.

"Yaaaay!" he cheers, excitedly wagging his tail. "I mean... nooooo! I mean..." he seems to be a little confused about his feelings. "I'm happy you did the challenge, it was really fun watching you go! But also, I was really hoping you'd lose! I don't have any slaves of my own, and you look like you'd be the perfect first one! Maybe even the only one if you're really good! Hey, what if..." The kobold puts on the biggest puppy-dog eyes he can muster. "...what if you say you lost anyways? Then I could collar you and we could keep having lots of fun together. Pleeeaaaase?"

You glare at him, unamused. He drops the act in return. "Eh, it was worth a shot!" He takes the key from around his neck and hands it over. "Here you go! Good luck up there!"

You unlock the door, head up the stairs, and are once again greeted by three doors. Checking the placards, you see a bee, a harpy, and yet again, a scratched-out sign. Considering each floor has a theme, the first was likely mammalian monsters, the second was reptilian monsters, and this one seems to be flying monsters.

Which door do you choose?

MP: 50/100
11133332322151511122121.title: You win the challenge!

choices: You fail to resist the honey and loose!
111333323221515111221211.content:
You frown as you look at your options.

Harpies are some of the worst monsters in the land. Their feet were horrible, they tended to be annoying and cocky on a level that even annoyed other monsters. It was not something you wanted to deal with.

And as for the blank door. No, just no. You weren't stupid enough to risk going in there.

And that just left the door on your left. As you walked closer to it, you frowned as you tried to remember what you knew about bee boys. They were rather elusive as monsters went, almost never seen. Most of them spent their time in their hives and never venturing out.

The only thing you really knew about them was that their feet weren't stinky. Not at all actually. It was said they smelled like honey and tasted like that.


Shrugging, you opened the door and walked inside. The room seemed to shimmer as the walls were coated in honey, which sent a nice, sweet smell. (-1 MP)

113131.content:
"You win our little wager, so the gold is yours."

The gargoyle lets the piece of stone fall to the dusty ground. the gargoyle wanders over to a nearby grave and digs through the hard earth with his claws. A small tattered bag is tossed in your direction. You catch the dust-covered pouch by its knotted string. The weight of the container surprises you. You open your new prize and find a welcoming sight glittering in the moonlight. (+200 gold.)

You wanted to ask the old monster where he acquired such wealth, but you had to reach the next town several miles away. You turn to leave and feel a familiar claw on your shoulder. You had no more business with the gargoyle boy, so what could he want with you? The old gargoyle would never survive outside of the cemetery, so a traveling companion was out of the question.

"Every monster in the kingdom knows of your quest. Reaching the monster king is a challenging goal. You have two paths you can choose. You can head east to the plains, or west to the marshes. The plains are filled with many wild animals, however, the path is longer though less dangerous. The marshes provide a shorter route, but many stronger monsters lurk along the path."

You thank the gargoyle for the helpful advice and set off on your journey. Your first task is getting a room and some new equipment in town. You wander along the winding trail for an hour, and soon you see lit torches in the distance. The night guard waves you past the gate, and you head to the inn. You pay for a room and decide to get some sleep. You can go shopping for new gear in the morning. (-20 gold.)
113131.title: A gift of gold and advice.

choices: Walk with your teacher back to the hideout.
1132.content:
You finally understood what your training was for.

The elder encouraged you to look about, to see what the monsters and demons had done; you nearly could not stomach the horrors you beheld. The entire village was in ruins; buildings were reduced to rubble, footprints longer and wider than you were tall lie marring the fields and unpaved roads. Every once in a while the wind changes directions, blowing up from the south, carrying the vile scent of the beast hordes.

The elder warned you about the monsters and their peculiar, yet unceasingly effective choice of tactics, and you tie a cloth over your face to protect your senses from the foul wind. You wonder for a moment if its already begun its mind-altering effects, but you shake your head. If you think that way, you may never be able to believe in your own thoughts again. Disgusted by what happened here, you proceed to the gates.

A massive crater marks the entrance of the town, the plaza is simply gone, and though the gate was intact, the walls on either side were simply gone; in their place stood two massive craters. You adjust the heavy pack on your shoulders and turn to the elder. She smiles weakly at you as you approach, worry plain on her face, but the pride in her eyes is unmistakable.

"You are the one that will succeed where we have all failed. Maybe if we were given another hundred years we could've..." She stops the thought and shakes her head. "It doesn't matter now. It's time to face the facts, they recognized us as a threat, and then they dealt with us." She spits on the ground, and her battle-hardened muscles tighten beneath old scars.

The wind picks up again, so you check the seals on your make-shift mask. Not perfect, but good enough for this distance, you don't even register a scent.

You place a hand on the elder's shoulders. "I will beat them to the other cities, Elder. It's as you said, they are an army, and I am one. I can move much faster than they can."

She does not reply, and her gaze seems distant.

You shake her shoulder, alarmed, before crying out, "Elder? Is everything okay, Elder?"

She grabs you by the wrist before driving your arm behind your back, and contorting the limb into a painful hold, you turn with it reflexively, as you were taught, and she stays one step ahead. You land hard on the ground staring up at her. She plants a boot on your chest.

"Always be ready, student." She smiles down at you warmly. "I just hope this is the right thing to do."

You push her booted foot off of you and she helps you to your feet. "It's the right thing to do, teacher -- It will be a hard journey, but you've taught me how to succeed where the others have failed. I am ready."

Her eyes fade back into that blank stare to the south. "You need to depart, child, and I need to get back inside, this wind is getting to my old bones, but first, take this with you -- you will need it much more than me." The elder pulls a pendant from around her neck and holds it up in front of her. It glows softly in the dusty ruins of your old village. "This is the will of our people, wherever you go, we will be with you. Child, remember your goal -- warn the other cities, and mount a defense. Do not go south, you are not ready; by the time you arrive, Xinnar will already be lost, and you will be overwhelmed..."

Her face contorts with worry or regret, either afraid for the fate of the world being left to your hands, or ashamed that she could not do more to help. She holds the pendant before you, focusing on it for a moment. Its glow grows more intense until it shines a bright white.

You take it and place it in a small pouch at your belt. You bow your head in thanks and tears well in your eyes. You feel sad to leave your teacher and your village behind, but also daunted by the path ahead. You fall to your knees under the weight of your duties and bow your head. "Thank you, Elder."

She gestures for you to stand and pulls you into a fierce hug. For the first time in your life, you hear sniffling come from your teacher. By the time you end your embrace, her tears have already dried, though her breaths come quicker than normal. You think you hear her voice quiver in her parting words.

"Be safe, Child."

MP: 100/100
Gold: 0

1132.title: A blessed amulet. (restores 50 MP one time upon...

choices: You calm yourself and wake up in the morning.
11322.content:
You leave the elder behind to bring an end to the destruction wrought by the monsters, determined to make sure no one else experiences such loss. You never look back.

An hour of walking over the sparse, rocky terrain, you find the mountain road that should take you all the way into Ironhaven.

The first day of travel is uneventful, and you settle for the night on a flat, rocky ridge. You can't see much, but you think better of lighting a fire for the night. You pull a waterskin and some bread that your baked earlier in the week. You down your meager feast without complaint, unsling a bedroll from your pack, and lie down for the night.

As you stare up at the dark, clouded sky, your teachers' stories about family members lost to the monsters begin to play out in your head. You remember her look of sadness when you wanted to seek out your friends and neighbors. She told you that they were gone, that the monster's army would use them all until they forgot who they were.

Your teacher had described the process once as a slow, insidious transformation. Your mind slowly let the idea of a monster's superiority in. Something about the scent of their feet made you crave more of it, even if you hated it. It was impossible for you to imagine it, but it must be true-- there were no bodies in the remnants of your village. No blood, no bone, just lives left behind.

As you fell asleep, you imagined the villagers new lives in the monster camp. In your dreams that night, you watched as those closest to you were kicked, stepped on, and humiliated. They were stuck in massive slime feet, struggling for freedom. They licked at the toes of disgusting ghouls while onlookers laughed. They were kicked away by orcs, as they scrabbled after their feet, until they begged to be smothered by massive green-skinned soles. Some simply lay face up, writhing in ecstasy under benches in the mess halls while the army idly played with their new toys during their meals. They were locked away in cages at night, begging for more, bashing their bodies into the bars not to escape, but to be abused further.

As you look around the camp, there is no human free. The strongest of your warriors is stripped naked, eating the toejam out from between a giant's toes. He seems to be enjoying himself one moment-- aroused, and moaning, but horrified the next-- sobbing, and running away. He falls to his knees before he leaves the firelight, and crawls back, just to repeat the process anew. You have to help him! You approach the giant quickly without thought and he pays you no notice as he drinks a tankard of ale the size of a tent, probably just happy to have a moment to kick off his boots during a seemingly endless march. Suddenly you crash into the thick scent of his unwashed feet. Your stomach heaves, but you soldier on. As you get closer the scent grows stronger and stronger until it's nearly a physical force. You feel yourself slowing down as you fight against the warm, sweaty air washing over you in waves of cheesy musk, but you make it to the warrior. He somehow smells worse than the surrounding air. How long had he been between this brute's filthy toes? You grab a hold of him and turn to run.

You make it out of the light of the giant's fire and back to relative safety when the warrior begins to panic. He pulls you frantically towards the giant. You try to pull away, but the man's grip is much too strong. You trip and he slowly drags you towards the disgusting toes. The giant looks down from his ale and smiles before those toes close around you both.

You jolt awake. You look around in the dark, frantic, but you see nothing. You hear nothing nearby. You reach for the pendant in your pouch, and let its light wash over you as you collect yourself.

Your dreams leave you covered in sweat, you're sticky, hot, and can't shake the image of the massive giant's toes sealing you inside their moist, cheesy grasp. (MP-3)

You pull your makeshift mask on over your face and try to get some sleep.

11322.title: Head out east to Ironhaven.

choices: Hold the glowing pendant aloft for light.
113221.content:
You stow your pendant and lie down on your bedroll. For a time, you stare up into the cloudy night's darkness. You feel the exhaustion of your day of travel setting in, but each time you begin to doze, your mind conjures up images of your loved ones being tortured at the feet of monsters. The inability to sleep makes you frustrated and irritable. Weariness fogs your mind, yet you resolve to resume your travels. (MP -5)

After you pack up, you pull your pendant out of its pouch and begin to travel by its light; its just bright enough to follow the road. You grumble at your slow passage through the dark. Every mile is hard won and much more perilous than it would be during the day. You're fully aware that sleep would be a much better use of your time, but thinking about it only makes you more frustrated for what you've lost. One more casualty of the monsters. (MP -1)

Your plodding travels are interrupted when you hear the sound of wings in the dark. You cannot see the source of the sound, but you can tell that the unseen wings belong to something bigger than any birds native to these mountains. You draw your steel rod to prepare for a fight and reach for your ancestral pendant.

MP: 91/100. (5 can be regained from restful sleep. )

113221.title: You cannot fall back asleep (MP -5)

choices: Pretend to obey to get close, fight the creature head on!
Flee and make your way to the city, or perhaps a cave.
1132212.content:
Your teacher trained you extensively in fighting against opponents with wings -- well, perhaps it's more apt to say that your teacher ran you through the scenario on more than one occasion. Practical experience was hard to come by as none of your training partners could fly.

If the unseen winged creature is smart and means you harm, you understand you're at a serious disadvantage; it could strike out at you without retaliation unless you got a hold of it or damaged its wings, which meant it could play things safe and weaken you slowly over the course of hours at little risk to itself.

Holding a light makes you a visible target. If you could fly, you would stay well out of the range of a potential opponent's light, only entering to strike, minimizing its usefulness.

You stow your pendant in a small pouch and secure it to a belt loop at your waist. As long as you get enough time for your eyes to adjust, you'll be better off. That, and if the pendant is as powerful as you believe it to be, you don't want to risk having a faster opponent nabbing it and running off.

You hear the wing beats grow steadily louder as the monster gets closer. You try to follow the sound with your eyes, but you have not yet adjusted to the darkness. You can barely even make out the outline of your steel rod held inches in front of you.

There is a final stroke of the creature's wings directly above you, and then you here the whisper of tree leaves off to your right. All but blind in the darkness, you whirl to face the sound of the movement and prepare to beat back any attack from that direction.

You strain your eyes against the dark for any sign of motion.

For a moment there is nothing, and then you feel a breath of the wind on your back. You turn much too slowly to react, and hundreds of pounds of weight in free fall crash into your gut. Despite moving with the attack, the blow sends you sprawling, and forces the air from your lungs in a sudden, wheezing, gasp. (HP-5)

As you fall, time seems to slow as your training takes over. Your mind begins sizing up your opponent:

You watch the monster, with impossible dexterity, spring off of your gut to hover inches above the ground, beating broad, leathery wings against the air. Each stroke carries the monster a few feet into the air before he falls and needs to repeat the process to stay aloft. It's hard to see much in the dark, but he looks to be about your height, with a similar build. The key difference is his wingspan, which is about three of your body laid out end to end in length. Even in the dark, blending into the night, they're an imposing sight. You realize you won't be able to stop your momentum in the air and get your feet back under you.

You hit the ground hard and gracelessly. (HP-1) Reflexively, you gasp for air to fill your lungs. In spite of your face covering, the faint aroma of foot odor registers in your mind in time to the beating of the creature's wings. (MP-1)

You scowl and readjust your face mask to make sure it will stay in place during the fight to come.

The monster beats his wings again. (MP-1) "I see. Clever you. " The monster hisses out his amusement at your mask. The inhuman sound, somewhere between a tiger's growl and the whisper of the wind causes you to shiver and makes your heart race. The monster's praise, much to your dismay, makes pride well up within you. (MP-1)

Another beat of his wings bathes you in the aroma of his feet. (MP-1) You groan in disgust.

"It seems that clever cloth of yours isn't a perfect solution. How much does it actually help, I wonder." The winged monster muses playfully. He's clearly enjoying himself.

You're unsure why he hasn't pounced to finish the job while you were stunned from his attack, but you seize the opportunity gratefully. You reluctantly fill your lungs with monster's scent in order to catch your breath. You refuse to show weakness and stifle a gag in response to the stench of his unwashed foot musk. (MP-1) You stand up to face him, weapon readied.

"We don't have to fight. I followed you for a long time -- I could use a warm, soft perch to sink my claws into.
I'd love to rest my weary wings." He punctuates the word wings with another downward stroke of the leathery appendages, and another wave of his scent. (MP-1) A condescending grin spreads across the winged creature's face. He raises his feet, extending them towards your face and splays his toes. As your eyes adjust to the dark, you see for the first time that his whole body is covered in short, silky, fur -- it looks black in the dark, but you can't be sure.

The feet he's showing off would be nearly human if not for the broader soles and opposable thumb joint at his heel. Each of his digits ends in a long claw that you'll have to watch out for. "Your face would fit perfectly in my grasp," he says, closing his foot into a fist to illustrate his point, and beating his wings to stay aloft. As if his words need to be heard and validated, you look deeply at his broad soles as his wings buffet your body with tainted air. (MP-1) You realize, much to your horror, that he's right, his strange, prehensile feet could hold your head flush against the source of his unapologetic odor. (MP-1)

"Come closer." The simple command comes out wild, predatory, and demanding. The same shiver of fear that assaulted you when he first spoke again has its way with your heart and sets it to racing. Some deep part of your brain reflexively causes you to move to obey, but your mind catches yourself mid-step. (MP-1)

Still mid-step, your mind is racing through options. You're fairly certain you cannot outrun this creature, and with the way his voice seems to bypass your thoughts, you do not want a drawn out fight. Perhaps you can use his command to your advantage and play along to get close. Maybe you can run, hide or fight off his attacks long enough to make it to Iron Haven. It's not far from here now, but you also might make it to the gate only to have no one manning it in the night. Perhaps you could negotiate, he seems intelligent, and if he's followed you for as long as he said, maybe he has a goal you could help him with in exchange for his departure, though it's difficult to treat with someone who is already playing with your mind.

You don't know what the right answer is, but you're certain you've suffered his gross feet and sorcerous words long enough .

1132212.title: Stow the pendant somewhere safer.

choices: Let go of your weapon, regroup, and finish.
Abandon the fight, grab your pack, and run.
11322121.content:
Your mind is screaming at you, asking questions that can't be answered.

What if he sees through your act? What if he's a stronger physical combatant than you? What if you've been exposed to his scent for too long already?

You wonder if he can hear your heart beating in your chest; you're pretty certain it's echoing through the entire mountain range at this point.

Is the sheen of anxious sweat giving your intentions away? Is it true that monsters can smell the scent of your fear?

The truth is that none of it matters. You filter out the noise of your fears, and you focus on your goal.

Your heart doesn't slow its breakneck pace, but your body never hesitates; you take one step closer, and then another. You walk towards the monster with a relaxed and steady gait. Your ears focus on the sound of his wings, and the memory of their position.

From what you've seen, each backstroke brings them up to the same position, and every downstroke carries them in the same arc. It seems to happen automatically and without thought; hovering there to him must be like standing would be to you -- completely habitual, automatic, and predictable.

It's easy to hit a target if you know where it will be, and monster or not, your village's steel is harder than bone. You're going to have to put up with the stench of his toxic toes for a moment longer, but after that...

In the wake of being toyed with, you allow yourself the satisfaction of your anger. You visualize your weapon ruining one of the creature's wings. You can practically feel the impact of your rod and the crunch of the delicate bones. It's hard not to speed up your pace.

You've covered most of the distance by the time another gust of warm air washes over you. You expected the smell to be stronger, but you vastly underestimated how much it was diminishing over the distance. This wave of air is accompanied by a wave of nausea that leaves you dizzy and swaying. The moist heat feels like it clings to your hair, your face, your mask. It feels like it's waiting to seep into your nostrils and flood your lungs; like it's intentionally smothering you into submission. (MP - 5)

Your reaction to his scent is completely involuntary, and not at all subtle. You're worried your revulsion is going to give you away. Instead, he laughs as if he had expected your reviled groans and glazed over stare. His laughter resonates in your ears and echoes in your head. Instead of the anger you expect to feel, you want to laugh with him, even though he's laughing at your pain. You want to apologize for your rudeness. (MP - 1)

"They aren't that bad, are they?" His nostrils move with his breaths as he sniffs at the air.

Thankfully, your unwelcome mirth fades away, when he speaks again. Anger quickly fills the void it left behind.

You force yourself to wear the foreign, jovial smile that crept across your face in order to keep up the charade. Your teacher would be ashamed if she saw you now, and you feel pangs of guilt. You feed them to the flames of your anger.

It was going to feel amazing to hit him.

For the first time since your training began years ago, you understand the full extent of the threat of a monsters' scent. You wrestle your consciousness back from the smothering grip of his noxious aroma and find that you've instinctively stumbled to within striking distance of your target.

Though you planned to strike his wing on the backbeat, your timing is off. You're unwilling to test if you can remain conscious through another concentrated lungful of his feet, so you abandon the plan and bring your rod down in a flashing arc towards his nearest wing.

The creature yelps in surprise and you feel the force of your blow reverberate up your weapon, into your wrists. (Monster HP -2) You don't feel the break you had hoped for, but he whirls into the earth, giving you time to reset your feet and strike again. Your rod flashes, finding light in spite of the cloudy night. It connects with a meaty thud and a yowl of pain as he pushes himself up to his hands and knees. (Monster HP -2)

He rolls to his back, but you waste no time, you bring the weapon back up and drive down with adrenaline-fueled anger. This time he catches the rod with his feet. Before you can curse yourself for letting anger get the better of you, his clawed digits wrap around the weapon and he yanks you forward with powerful legs.

Your body lurches off balance, and you feel yourself start to fall. His free foot reaches up to grab your throat, but you twist away. His claws shred your mask and dig into your cheek underneath; blood begins to well up and bead along the scratch. (HP-1)

His inhuman screech of triumph pierces the night, and you realize the implications of what had just happened. The winged beast pulls back his wings, unfurling them awkwardly in pained and panicked fits along the ground. He raises his shoulders off of the ground and you hear the air rushing towards you before you can see the edges of his wings in your peripheral vision.

Well, fuck.
