12131221112111111.content:
After you choose your perk and level up, you hear a familiar voice: "It was awful rude of you to run away while i was having fun... Looks like i'm going to have to punish you!" It was the devil boy from earlier!

Your MP: 110/110
Devil's HP: 9/10
Your attack is 6 (bare hands + heavy handed)*Krolm's Rage=(1+2)*2

Do you want to try your luck again, or will you play it safe and run away?
12131221112111111.title: Heavy Handed

choices: Walk on! The sooner you reach Baxton, the better.
Camp here! Rather camp where it is safe over losing a few hours worth of walking
You are approached by a figure as you struggle to decide. Friend, or foe?
122.content:
Young, beautiful, just coming of age and ready to take on the world. You, as a prime woman in a small village, set out with merely an old rod that was gifted to her by the village priestess, and a backpack with enough food to last you to the next town where you'll have to buy some more, conveniently only possessing enough to purchase as much as well. Why leave a perfectly comfortable life, with the man of your choosing in your small home village? When you were at the age of 10, a small stealthy raid carried out by a local marauding tribe of weak goblins, orcs and trolls that only possessed the strength to attack helpless targets such as your home, kidnapped your mother and murdered your father in his sleep. They made off with a small fortune from your house too. This left you with a bitter resentment and hatred of the monsters, more than just the mere fear of your fellow kin. You weren't scared of them, you were furious at them, and you wanted to get them back.

11 years later, back to the present, you take in a deep breath while clutching your rod, packing it away in a neat pocket over your shoulder, you wave good bye to the priestess and began your journey along the trail into the hilly plains and light forest area. It'd be at least 2 or 3 days worth of travel before you could reach the town of Baxton. It was the local centre of trade, all the farmers from the local villages hauled their harvest to Baxton to sell and buy their goods. Officially, the town had outlawed monsters and set an eye raising bounty on the capture of, or the killing of any monsters, but in reality the human underground had a deal with a fair few of the various tribes in the area to smuggle monsters in to allow them to do their kidnapping, stealing and other unsavoury activities. It was your goal to attempt to seek employment, or at least, training from the town's guard so you can start pushing back against these beasts. The first challenge would be convincing them to even consider your offer however, as naturally they wouldn't let a woman into their barracks if they weren't a prostitute.

Turning your thoughts away from what you set out to do however, as you do have a few days alone to just think things through, you spot a nice looking, solitary tree at the top of a smallish hill just off your path. It's still fairly light, and you wager that you have an hour or two before you even need to think of setting up camp for the night. On one hand, if you continue then obviously you won't have to worry about walking extra distance tomorrow to cover for what you're losing now, but on the other hand, you may not find a more favourable place to stay for the night. It'd be horrible if you were attacked and kidnapped on the first night of your quest! What is the best course of action?

MP: 100
122.title: Young adult

1223.content: You snap out of your dilemma and go into a defensive stance, eyes fixated on the being who approaches you, though they seem rather calm. You realise that you have been approached by...
1223.title: You are approached by a figure as you struggle ...

choices: Accept the offer, with two of you, there's virtually no risk of a night raid!
Reject his offer, this is clearly a scheme to get you to lower your guard.
12233.content:
Widening your eyes as the goblin, who was no higher than your waist approached you alongside a small creature the size of a dog that was carrying the goblin's goods. Taking a step back, you reach up with your one hand to grab your rod and the goblin immediately raises his own hands to try and calm you down.

"W-woah, woah there ma'am, I didn't mean to startle you! I'm merely a travelling merchant" He exclaims in a surprisingly.. well, let's just say intelligent tone. You lower your hand back down to your side and calm yourself, nodding. You had heard stories of lone goblins who weren't part of any raiding parties, ones who were far, far more intelligent compared to the vast majority of their brethren. Sometimes, they were friendly, attempting to integrate with which ever human society that would let them. Other times, they pretended to be friendly to achieve the same goal that most monsters were known for. These smarter goblins did have one advantage over most though, and that was their highly, highly addictive semen. One drop accidentally swallowed, even if it were mixed in with powerful alcohol, caused the victim to have an intense, insatiable desire for it. It was time to figure out whether this one was one of those, or merely what he claimed to be, a merchant. Though, regardless of the answer, it seemed like he wasn't much of a threat. He possessed no weapon that you could see, and he hardly looked like he could throw a punch that'd be more painful than walking your leg into a wall.

"Alright, alright, I'm sorry. Don't try anything funny though." You reply in a hostile tone. You took a good look at him up and down. His skin was light grey, the only clothes he wore was a cloth wrapped around his waist and though he was small, he definitely looked well fed. Perhaps he was a wealthy merchant, or simply had a good meal recently. He had a long nose and fairly pointy ears which didn't really make his face look all that appealing, by human standards at least. His feet though, they were pretty big! Definitely bigger than most human's, they were more than double the size of yours, and pretty.. soft looking too. Standing up straight, keeping at least two metres or so distance between him and you, you wait for him to reply.

"Like I said ma'am, I'm merely a travelling merchant! After getting harassed by patrolling guards from Baxton, I turned around and decided to seek out friendlier settlements. Would you ah.. know of any? Pardon me, but you don't seem like you have travelled very far just yet. Perhaps you could point me to where you have just come from?" He replied, seeming a bit more cautious now himself. That at least told you that he wasn't interested in aggravating you.

"I uh.. Uh yeah, but it'll take half a day at least, and the road at night isn't really that safe" You say back, calming yourself more and laying off your hostile attitude. Sure, you absolutely despised monsters and wanted to see them burn, but you've never met ones like these. Perhaps he is to be given a chance?

Nodding slowly, the goblin casts a look down the road behind you, then around as well. He remained silent for an uncomfortable moment before replying yet again.
"Thank you, ma'am. If that is the case, then perhaps.. we should camp together? That tree there looks like an excellent spot. I'm merely offering because we'd be safer together, but if you do not wish for someone like me to keep you company, then I'll be on my way."

His offer made you twitch you head a bit, you were about to exclaim 'no' before you thought about it. He had a point! Besides, he has been friendly so far despite you being rude to him.
12233.title: A goblin... merchant?

choices: Give in to your unexplained urges, take a closer look
Resist these foul temptations! Sit on the other side of the tree.
122331.content:
Against your prejudice, against the cries from your common sense, you sigh and nod back at the goblin. He himself seemed to have had a rough day anyway.

You didn't say anything more to him, you merely turned around and began a slow walking pace towards this tree, allowing him to catch up with you. "What's your name, then? Mine is Emily" You say after he caught up with you, in a noticeably more friendly tone. He smiled at this when you weren't looking.

"Bogwart. A name of my own choosing, as the one given to me by my people was.. well, let's just say, ungraceful. Glad to have met you, Emily." He lost his smile a small bit, but still, appeared pleased. When the two of you approached the tree, you began gathering kindle for a fire before he shook his head frantically at you. Surprised, you cocked your head and listened

"No, no! That would be like a beacon, telling every possible raider around that we're here. It's fine, we won't get cold and I have food already" He said. Already, that made him trust you more, and it wasn't the offering of food, though of course that was nice! "Oh! Oh, okay. Well, if you insist. Thank you for the food, but I have my own already. I'm a picky eater" You explain, gently throwing away the kindle before setting yourself down against the tree, Bogwart getting his creature to lay down opposite you while he leaned against it. From then on, the two of you chatted about many, many things, ranging from Bogwart being exiled and making his own living to what the two of you wanted to do. It seemed his dream was to open a large business one day to sell clothes made from exotic materials!

During all of this, you found your eyes being unnaturally drawn to his extended feet. One was pressed to the ground so you could only see the tops, while the other had it's sole directly pointed at you. They were slightly dirty and dusty, but still, unusually enjoyable to look at! (-10 MP) You tried to shake your gaze away, forcing yourself to stare at Bogwart's face, though that obviously didn't work, forcing yourself to look around at your environment but it all always ended the same - with you staring at his feet. Was he doing this, or was something inside of you compelling you to look? Why were you even looking, what was it that you wanted to do to them!? (-15 MP)

Bogwart saw you struggling, but made an effort to not react to it. His plan was working. "Which brings me to my final point - the simple cloth and wool from this continent is appalling to make clothing with. It's simply appalling! I mean, that's why I don't even bother with shoes! Luckily, us goblins have feet that are far better for going bare than humans, even if they identically looking." He finished off, making you snap out of your trance

"Wh-wha? Oh, yes! Absolutely. Appalling, totally appalling..." You stutter and trail off, clearly showing that you weren't listening. The two of you shared a smile, his a knowing one while yours guilty. "Okay I promise I was listening at least a little!" You laugh before he waved his hand at you dismissively.

"Worry not, Emily! It is merely the company, and perhaps the chance to talk freely that is enjoyable. I do not expect you to take interest in my passions, very few do. But, it is late now, and I do not wish to wake up after sunrise, so I'll be going to sleep." He replied back in a comforting tone, finishing off with a yawn. "I wish you the best of luck on your watch. Feel free to wake me if you need anything of me" Bogwart finished off before merely stretching his arms and feet out, rolling over and pressing his head against the belly of his creature and passing out.

That was that! You were to take the first watch of a few hours, and then wake him so that he could take his. It had been right to trust him after all, then. You'd even go so far as to say you enjoyed his company. Still though, as you survey the area idly, looking for movement or any signs of a raid, it becomes clear that the night is as calm as ever. The worst thing that could happen is that a stray rabbit wanders into your camp.

As the minutes pass by, your eyes keep on getting lured into the same trap, staring at his exposed soles and toes. Why were they so smooth looking? So.. so.. kissable? (-10 MP) This had to stop, you couldn't keep on staring. Clearly something inside of you was wrong, or he was working some sort of magic. You should just sit on the other side of the tree to shield yourself from the sight of his feet!

On the other hand however, he was asleep, and clearly, totally unaware. He wouldn't even notice it if you just.. just sneaked over and took a closer look, right?
MP: 65/100
122331.title: Accept the offer, with two of you, there's ...

choices: Refuse and put a stop to this madness (+30 MP)
1223311.content:
They're just too strong, his feet just look too good, you need more! A little voice in the back of your head told you this was wrong, but it wasn't nearly powerful enough to influence your decision. Silently, you shifted your feminine legs and crawled over, positioning yourself just behind him. Breathing a bit heavily, the goblin seemed to be in deep sleep already, so you figured you were safe.

Taking in a deep breath, you lean over and examine his dusty, dirty, yet smooth and elegant soles up close. It was totally different from the rest of him, his feet were amazing! Bogwart seemed like a normal goblin in his appearance everywhere, except for his feet. They were well cared for, and just had that right look. Something inside of your stirred (-15 MP). You don't know how long your face was mere inches away from his soles, just staring and admiring away, idly taking in his foot scent which didn't seem that bad at first, but clearly was having an effect.

Minutes, maybe even hours went by before you did something else. You cursed yourself for doing this, but, just like before, you couldn't help but give in to your urges. You pursed your lips, closed your eyes, and pressed a kiss to the middle of his sole on his right foot. Everything inside of you tingled with joy as your lips made contact, and when they left his sole, leaving a *smack* sound, you were left with a longing for more! You had to do it again!(-20 MP) Before you could contemplate your situation however, a voice spoke up. It was Bogwart's!

"Good girl" He said in a soft tone, causing you to pull back in surprise, scurrying back to your spot by the tree. He shifted a bit and turned over, grinning with glee at you. "I- Wha.. Don't call me that!" You reply indignantly, stuttering for a response. He just laughed at you. "Why not, human? Clearly, you know your place already, so that makes you a good girl." He cooed out teasingly. He didn't make any movements, but he was definitely showing his feet off a lot more, causing you to stare downwards as per usual.

"I had my suspicions as we spoke, but decided to give you the benefit of the doubt. You did, after all, give me a chance, so I decided to give you one, and this is how you spend it. Not that I'm complaining. I'm not even forcing you, or convincing you otherwise, you did this all on your own!" Bogwart reasoned, not really giving you room to reply. "You're too embarrassed, too tense, little Emily! Relax. It's us two. If you wish to admit your inferiority and worship me as your superior through my feet, then go ahead. We can even make it our little arrangement if you so wish, but that will have strings attached of course. Don't answer that question just yet, you need to think on it! But, while you do, why don't you just contemplate what you have to gain?" Bogwart explained further, making you think more.

He was right in all his points. He never forced you, you did this on your own! You kissed his feet, you brought this upon yourself, and now he was offering you something that perhaps was the best possible outcome? Still though, this was disgraceful. You could never truly commit to your quest if you accepted this. Bogwart saw the struggle inside of your head and smiled more. He was pleased that you didn't merely have another outburst immediately. Perhaps he knew that you were his already?

"I know your desires, Emily. Go on. Kiss my feet, call me Master Bogwart, admit that I'm better than you, that you belong beneath me. I know it to be a fact, you merely need to accept it yourself." He pushed further. As if to emphasise his point of him being better, he stood up, took a few cautious steps to stand right in front of you and loomed over you, his feet on the ground right in front of you while his face was above.

MP: 30/100
1223311.title: Give in to your unexplained urges, take a close...

123.content:
Your name is Nua, and you are a bounty hunter. You belong to a reclusive tribe of warrior women, who live in secrecy away from any men to keep themselves safe from the rampant monster boys who lurk in the shadows. For years, you have trained and proven yourself a skilled combatant even among your peers. Growing bored of your home and hating hiding, you have been voluntarily banished from your village to seek adventure. To protect your homeland, you have vowed to never return.

This was a long time ago, you have been hunting bounties for a handful of years and have gotten quite good at it. The local villages often call upon you to to track, capture or slay any monsters bold enough to attack them in their homes. It was easy enough work, but recently even your veteran experience has been put to the test. Monsters have become bolder in their attacks and seem stronger than you've seen in years. Still, you will not falter. A mighty woman such as yourself will not fall to the feet of these vile beasts!

You carry with you a large club, which deals 3 points of damage and serves to augment your already formidable barehanded strength of 2. You carry with you a dozen gold left over from your last bounty, some rudimentary camping supplies, and a few meals of dried jerky. You wear only leather boots and a loin cloth which hangs to your knees. Your chest is bear, to show off both your breasts and your muscles. You're quite proud of both.

You are embarking on a bounty that the locals claimed would be the most dangerous one of your life. Your quest is hunting...
123.title: Warrior Woman

choices: Circle back and head in the front
Sneak through the graves and head for the castle
Hunt the creature in the graveyard
1231.content:
Your quarry on this mission was a vampire lord that had been terrorizing the local village, stealing people from their beds and taking them to his grim castle where they are never seen again. At least not in the same way they were before. Boys abducted by the lord often end up returning as mind-numbed ghouls, serving the dark lord's will with their vile, corrupted feet. Women and girls stolen by the vampire, however, are truly never seen again. It leads one to think that they are drained or worse, condemned to a life of suffering and slavery at the foul feet of tue undead.

Still, you do not falter. In the dead of the night you creep over to the Vampire Lord's castle, knowing that your best chance to catch him is while he's out of his tomb. Arriving at his gates, torch in hand, you survey the area. The gate is unlocked, and you assume the front door is as well. But the idea of traipsing directly into his foyer doesn't sit well with you. You circle the perimeter of the castle to see if there is any alternate entrances, and you find that around the back of the castle is a massive graveyard which has a balcony overlooking it. You could easily creep through the graveyard, climb up to the balcony and take him by surprise.

There's just one problem: The stench of the graveyard is beyond words! It's so disgusting that just standing at the edge of it causes you to take 5 MP damage. You certainly aren't going to want to meet whatever that reek is coming from. But then again, your hunter's spirit compels you. You can't stand the idea that something that evil is lurking in these graves, and you're sure that you could fetch a bonus reward for its head. Eventually you decide...

(MP 95/100)
1231.title: Souless, not Soleless

12313.content:
You decide to head into the graveyard to hunt down whatever is making that ghastly stench, but before you do, you prepare a bit so the stink doesn't overwhelm you. You take a bandanna from your satchel and rub some floral perfume into it before wrapping it around your face. It's a technique that's served you very well in traversing the stinking lairs of other monster boys. Still, the perfume can only hold up against the pungent reek of them for so long, so you mustn't dawdle.

You leap the short fence of the graveyard and start to creep along the loamy ground. The soil beneath you is soft, almost marsh-like and any vegetation save for moss and mushrooms has long since died. Probably from the stink. In the distance, you hear a strange, animal like rustling and decide to follow it. As you creep along, you see a gaggle of boys, zombified and emaciated, lumbering around in the darkness. Their footsteps are too slow to be the beast you heard, though, and they haven't noticed you, so you decide to snuff your torch and keep low to the ground to avoid them. It's hopeless to try and help them, you can only spare them a beating. But as you creep past them, something catches you off guard. A zombie you hadn't noticed stumbles out in front of you, and you freeze. He still doesn't notice you, but at this distance the raw stink of his feet is palpable even past your bandanna.

-5 MP!

He cranes his head towards the misty sky, sniffs around a bit, then staggers off, allowing you to move on. You sneak onward, following the noise in the distance. You reach what seems to be the center of the cemetery, where a large mausoleum sits. Your eyes are immediately drawn to the enormous stone door, which has been moved aside leaving the crypt wide open. But as you approach it, you hear that same, bizarre rustling noise behind you in the trees. Is the creature you seek hiding in the crypt, or did it escape from it? Then again, perhaps the noise you were following was a dead end?

(MP 90/100)
12313.title: Hunt the creature in the graveyard

choices: A slimy monster taking a nap
1232.content: Of course when you first took the quest, you figured you were going to face a simple 'sit in a cave atop mountain of stolen goods and burned sheep skin' sort of dragon. Upon further examination however, you found a different level of dragon. This dragon was an odd subspecies that prefered to hide itself in lakes and marshes of low depth. Like most dragons, few who went after this subspecies came away unscathed. With little fear if any in your heart however, you stepped through the forest following a stream that supposedly led to a rather dense marsh. You keep your eyes about you, ready to attack anything that came your way. As you walk along the stream, you notice an odd glinting in the river. You ready your club in the event of danger as you approach.
1232.title: A Dragon

choices: Keep walking, it's not worth your time.
Wake him up... and ask for directions???
12322.content:
As you approach the shimmering in the water, you come very close to tripping over a pair of webbed, flipper-like feet! Thankfully, you catch them just before you foot brushes against them, preserving your stealth. Now that you're closer, you can see the owner of the feet: a frog boy. You know about these kinds. They make excellent swimmers, and their agility on land shouldn't be underestimated either. They like smothering their victims beneath their large, webbed feet in order to drag them off to their homes. And, as to be expected, "slimy" doesn't even BEGIN to describe the texture of their skin. They constantly ooze out a thick, mucous-y, malodorous slime. Not only does it make them slippery and hard to capture, it also has mystical properties... or so you've heard. Not many people walk away from an encounter with a frog boy with their mind in one piece... speaking of which, are you sure it's safe to stand in the stream his smelly goo has been polluting? You don't feel any different... but you sure can smell the reek of feet coming from the water! (-4 MP)

Your MP: 96/100
12322.title: Frog Boy

123221.content: Who attacks, him or you?
123221.title: Time for a surprise attack!

choices: "...make you lick the slime from my feet!"
Before he can decide, something interrupts him!
1232211.content:
You carefully step around the frog boy, being careful not to wake him. Just as you think you're in the clear, a slimy tendril wraps around your leg. You look down and see it's not a tendril- its a pink tongue! Tracing it back, you can see it's attached to the frog boy, who you erroneously assumed was sleeping.

You raise your club, ready to crush the tongue beneath it, but at the apex of your swing, the frog boy yanks his tongue towards himself, sending you falling onto your back into the murky water below! (-4 MP) To make matters even worse, you fumbled your club, dropping it a few feet away from you! Before you can get up, the frog boy plants a foot on your chest, keeping you pinned down. (-5 MP)

"You hero types are so dull, you know?" the frog boy taunts. "All I have to do is pretend to doze off and you'll act like I'm not even there! You're the third human I've got with this trick this week!" You glare at the frog boy's satisfied smirk. You thrash against the foot, but it's hardly effective. Even though you're stronger than any human you've ever met, you can still barely manage to make the frog boy, who has evolved strong legs for jumping and swimming, to move a muscle. Is the strength between humans and monsters truly this apparent? (-5 MP)

The frog boy sits down on your stomach, pinning your shoulders to the streambed with his feet. Ugh, you can smell them from here! (-5 MP) "Now, what to do with you..." the frog boy ponders. "Oh, I know! I'll..."

Your MP: 78/100
Frog boy's HP: 10/10
1232211.title: He attacks

choices: He’s not waking up anytime soon, let’s give those feet some love!
No, continue on with your mission.
1232212.content:
You rush towards the Frog Boy, Club in hand. You successfully manage to completely get the jump on him, hitting him square in the head with your Club! (-5 HP). The Frog Boy let out a pained cry in response and before he could retaliate, you hit him yet again (-5 HP), managing to knock the Frog Boy unconscious! He lets out a quiet and pained gasp falling onto his face, his smelly webbed feet falling into the Stream. He didn’t seem to drop anything after being defeated. However, you were suddenly finding yourself attracted to the Frog Boy’s feet. Perhaps being near his scent for so long has started to erode your Mind? You grab the Monster by his wrist as you pull him up from the river, his shimmering feet now back on solid land. For some reason, you almost feel drawn to his feet. As if they’re calling to you...

(-12 MP)
1232212.title: You attack

choices: Some form of crab monster boy
123222.content:
As you covered your nose, you passed by the frog without so much as a word. You didn't have time to deal with a low-grade monster who wasn't even attacking. You shake your head as you get out if his smell range. What possesses people to fall victim to smelly, filthy feet like that is quite beyond you. With the water dragon on the mind though, you keep walking down stream as it kept getting wider. The area around you slowly darkened as the trees twisted and the ground softened. For some reason, the whole area began to smell of the assulting stench of monster boy feet. Not prepared for it, you take a wiff before closing your nose again. (-4 MP)

As you step beyond the stream, you notice the muck bubbling suddenly as a form began to rise from it.
123222.title: Keep walking, it's not worth your time.

1232221.content:
You're ankle-deep into the strange-smelling mud as it stirs beneath your feet. You take a few steps back and grip your club tightly as you watch the mud shift and bubble. Right before your eyes, the mud raises from the ground! A huge mound of it, maybe eight feet tall, shifts around. First, two arms stick out of the form, then it shapes two legs, each ending with five-toed feet. Finally, a chest and head forms, revealing its true form: a golem! Golems aren't technically "monsters," but rather, nonliving constructs, usually made from ordinary material such as stone or clay. Powerful magic users often create these beings for manual labor, running errands, or in cases such as these, defending an area from interlopers. You can only assume there's a magically adept monster boy nearby who created this, no human mage would ever leave their creation in a monster boy's territory.

The golem boy looks at you... and kicks out with one big foot! He's much too far away to hit you, but it seems that wasn't his goal. Instead, slime rains from the foot and all over your body, coating you with footmud! It smells just as foul as your environment, and it seeps into your clothes. It'll take forever to get this out... (-8 MP)

Your MP: 84/100
Golem's HP: 15/15
1232221.title: A living being of muck

choices: A foot slam of harsh power
The being only warns you before sinking away (for now)
12322211.content:
Putting your focus from the shirt to the monster now walking towards you, the grip on the club tightens. If this being could rise from the muck, than running wouldn't work. Although the muck hindered your speed, you were still able to run around the lumbering golden. Using your momentum, you slammed into the golem's leg causing some stagger. You had no time to feel proud though as your close proximity have the golem what seemed to be a great opening. You prepare for a possible attack, unsure how you would hold up.

Golem HP 12/15
MP: 84/100
12322211.title: Fight!

123222111.content:
You see the golem rising its massive foot into the air, high above your head. You try to turn tail and run out from out the muddy foot, but it's no use! Your legs are slowed down by the swampy mud making up the ground below you! You can only raise your arms in a feeble attempt to stop the foot before it comes crashing down on you!

SLAM!!! [-10 MP]

The foot comes down with an absolutely staggering blow, sending you falling to your back beneath the mighty foot. Strangely enough, the foot doesn't seem to be putting pressure on you. You realize why when you see exactly how the foot is pressed on you. The big and index toes are at both sides of your head. They're wiggling and pushing against your head, covering it with foul footmuck. (-5 MP) Honestly, it's not so bad. The mud is soft, and it feels almost like a massage, and you could see yourself getting used to the smell...

But right now, you need to get out of here! You push against the foot with all your might, hoping to throw the golem off-balance and get back on your feet!

Your MP: 69/100
Golem's HP: 12/15
123222111.title: A foot slam of harsh power

choices: He orders the given to let you go
1232221113.content: As you try to think of a way to get this golem off of you, the sounds of something else approaching becomes known. While you struggle, unintentionally running more of the muck into yourself, (-2 MP)A voice begins to accompany the sounds of feet. "....keeping that golem in line, seriously when I get my hands on the person who put me in charge of that...." Tramping through the bushes, an unusual figure entered the light of the area. The being wore a long cloak decorated to look like the area around them. A tuft of the person's blue hair seem to brush in front of thier face, partally covering thier light green eyes. In thier hands were a huge hug that you figured best not to ask about and a book of some sort. "Oh..." the male voice said he looked to your direction, "...looks like my little pet caught something." You squint as you try to determine the rest of his features and he seems to be doing the same. "Well...you Don't look like a monster boy..."
1232221113.title: The golem's owner reveals themselves!

choices: Massage his feet .... NOW! You wanted this information at all cost!
Refuse and attack him to force him to tell you!
123223.content:
You thought it could be a good idea to ask that frog boy the way, who knows, perhaps he knew something since he lived here. As you approached him, you could feel the feet odor from it's original source (- 4 MP: 92). You tried to wake him up, but while you did it, the frog boy took advantage of that and while he was stretching, he "accidentally" putted his slimy foot in your face for freaction of a second (- 2 MP = 90).

"Oh! A human! Hello human!"

While he spoke, he stretched his legs in your direction and was now in a sitting position.

"Ok monster, I need your help!"

"Me?"

"Do you see another monster around?"

He did that on purpose to make you lose time and make you stay longer in his foot odor! (- 3 MP = 87 remaining).

"No I don't ... so what do you want?" He smiles at you in a cocky way.

"I wanted to know if you had information about a dragon."

"A dragon? What is it again?"

he obviously played dumb to continue to make you smell his feet (- 3 Mp = 84 remaining)!

"Don't play dumb with me or you'll regret it!" you stared at him with a stern look

"Ok ok ... so you want to know if I saw a ... a what again?"

"A Dragon!!! A big flying lizard!!!"

You yelled at him and when you finished you breathed more air than usual to fill your lungs! But this tim you filled them with the nice odor of a nice slimy monster with nice hypnotic feet! (- 5 MP = 79 remaining)

"Oh! .... oh yeah a dragon! Why didn't you tell it sooner?"

"..." you had a very angry look on your face

"What is the dragon's color?"

"I don't care about his color! There are not many dragons in the world, let alone in that region!"

"Well ... fortunately you met me! I'll teach you a few things! So first of all, there are more dragons than you think! And then, their skin color is important: for example green dragons! Have very stinky feet!"

"Very ... strinky ... feet?"

You continued to breath and the fact he mentioned the dragon's feet were stinky made you lose more MP than usual for some reason (- 5 MP = 74 remaining). You lost 1/4 of your MP and you start to think monsters' feet are not bad ... and the fact you stand here near that frog boy and his smelly feet clearly doesn't help you.

The frog boy smirked because he understood the power of his feet started to affect you. "Oh yeeeeeeeeeeaaaaaaaaaaaah! They're veeeeeeeeery stinky!"

You blushed as he simply talked about it (- 1 MP = 73 remaining). Such was the power of his feet: in addition to what monster are usually capable to do with their feet, the slime on the frog boy's feet makes you very interested in feet! Right now you wanted to learn more about that dragon's feet! It suddenly became very important for you! Not wanting to upset someone who could give you information. You started to act more obligingly with him!

"How stinky exactly?" You were obviously very interested to say the least

"Hum ... to incalculable levels!"

You blushed as he said that and breathed more of the toxic air (- 4 MP = 69 remaining).

"Is that real?"

"Yes! And that's not all!"

"What! There's more?" you were like a very attentive student listening to his teacher! The creature's strategy was perfect! he almost got you.

"Yeah! a green dragon can increase the odor of his feet ... as much as he wants! He can multiply it by 2, 5, 10, 100, 1000 or even 1 000 000 if he wants to!"

"Oh gooooood!" You blushed even more and started to feel aroused because of that (- 2 Mp = 67 remaining).

"And I still got another information for you!"

"There's even more?!"

"yes: you see ... they can also make their already gigantic feet even bigger!"

Hearing it and breathing to the toxic air made you lose 6 MP (61 reamining)! You couldn't believe how lucky you were! You felt very very "hot" when you heard that. Now you wanted to chase that dragon even more than before but for a total different reason!

"Where did he go? Where did he go?"

"Hum ... I don't know if I should tell you!"

"pleeeeeeeeeaaaaaaaase tell me!"

"Okay I'll tell you but first ... frog boys like me love to have their feet massaged so perhaps you could ... you know" he then gave you a nice smile and putted his feet in your direction.
123223.title: a vicious creature!

choices: The frog boy honors his deal and tells you where the dragon is.
The frog boy demands more footy fun!
1232231.content:
You felt a bit lightheaded as the frog boy shoved his feet into your face. His slimy, webbed toes wiggled just inches from your face, daring you to come closer. Now that they were close to you, you could smell them in their full glory instead of through passing wafts from afar, and were they ever potent! Your knees quivered and your sex throbbed as the frog boy scrunched his wide, long, delicious soles. (-5 MP)

You slowly reached forward towards the feet, slightly in awe of their power. Your thumbs sink into one of his soles, and its just as soft as you imagined. You dug your thumbs in and slid them around, his slimy secretions serving as an excellent natural lubricant. The frog boy moans happily as you massage his foot. "Yes dear, juuuuuuuust like that..." Suddenly, the frog boy lunges his free foot forward, pressing it against the side of your face! You could REALLY smell the strong odor radiating from his foot now that your nose is wedged into his insole! You find yourself involuntarily taking a few quick huffs, filling your lungs with his cheesy, sour scent. (-5 MP)

Just as quick as the frog boy pressed his foot against your face, he pulled it back, leaving only a slimy footprint. "Whoops, sorry! I just get so heated when I get a good massage like this!" You could tell from his voice that he was lying and completely meant to shove his foot in your face, but for some reason, you didn't really mind that much. Normally, you would've wanted to tear this monster limb from limb for taking advantage of you like that, but there's just something about his feet that just makes you feel so... best not to think about it too much. (-2 MP)

After a few minutes of massaging, you switch feet. It takes some time to get a full massage due to the size of the flipper-like feet, but at least the frog boy seemed to enjoy every second of it... and so did you, if you were being honest with yourself.

Your MP: 49/100
1232231.title: Massage his feet .... NOW! You wanted this info...

choices: Try to break free of his control
12322312.content: As you massage the frog boys foot, He moves his other foot to your face and rests it there with your nose in between his toes. "Smell" he commands. You offer no resistance, deeply inhaling his intoxicating scent as your worries about the dragon begin to slip away, replaced by thoughts of obeying this kind frog boy. "Good girl, keep smelling like an obedient servant, falling further into my spell, until your completely under my power. my smelly, slimy frog feet are your only concern." As he says these things, you begin to believe it, dropping more and more under his influence, as you continue smelling his hypnotic feet. (-20 MP)
12322312.title: The frog boy demands more footy fun!

13.content: who could it be and from what series?
13.title: Male (Different series)

131.content:
Sir Summer (Not from a series...hope that's ok!)

MP: 100/100
Gold: 300
Inventory: Steel armor, warhammer, backpack, rations, holy cross.

You are Sir Summer, a 24 year old knight from a fairly rich family. A well trained fighter who has been tasked to retrieve a duchess's daughter. Despite your skills as a fighter....you've never actually faced a monster boy...but you've always dreamed of taking on the mysterious Monster King!
----------------------------------------------------------

You read the papers from the Duchess's administration. Her daughter was kidnapped two nights ago, the guards spotted three monster boys...before they were knocked out and stank out by their truly awful feet. Then the garrison spotted one fleeing into the mountains, another into the dungeons and a third into the swamps. All heavy Monster Territory...you've got to chase on of the leads, but only one will lead to the hostage.
131.title: Sir Summer

choices: Continue riding, even if it tires you.
1311.content:
The dungeons is your go to, but you had to dig a little deeper. You knew one of the guards who reported the kidnapping and sat down with him. An older fellow who was not of a high title, but a well known and reliable soldier amidst the ranks. When asked, he gives a slightly rendition to the report you were given.

"Well sir, two monsters were scouting ahead and smothering the guards, I managed to see the one taking the princess! This slimey...pinkish fellow! The young lady seemed out of it, it looked as if she was going willingly with him. Dark magics they have, to pervert a girls mind, surely. I did my duty and confronted him! My strikes kind of...wobbled off of him and before I knew it a rotten slimey foot was upon me! It stank like you'd expect...with the additional scent of strawberries..." Strawberries? That clinched it! "Thank you my friend. Your testimony may have saved the girl from a horrible fate." You get up and gather your armour, demanding a servant pack me food, a tent and supplies! You know the monsters that took them. They had to be the sugary savages from no other mountain...but Candy Mountain! It was said one of the Monster King's most powerful minions had corrupted the mountain with his deceitful magic, creating an entire new kind of monster boy. The old man must've fallen victim to a jelly boy.

In a couple of hours you are mounted and on your way towards the mountain. Luckily it's summer so camping should be fine. You spend a few hours riding through unkempt roads and fields. Soon the road winds into a forest, but before the forest begins there is a cosy little cabin, the windows are lit and the chimney is burning. You should camp for the night, and it's probably warmer and safer in there...but it could be monster territory.
1311.title: You go to the mountains.

13111.content:
You were more than prepared to walk past the cabin. After all, you're the last person to let a cool breeze bring a falter in your step. However, it would be much more pragmatic to try the cabin than risk an ambush by camping. Hopefully, it's a human home, and if not... well, you'll just have to evict its occupants, won't you?

You dismounted your horse and strolled up to the door of the cabin. Up close, you can see it's not exactly the most inviting cabin: the wood is chipped in various places, and the logs aren't quite aligned perfectly. Either it was built in a hurry, or by someone (or something) who only has basic knowledge of cabin construction. Or, in the worst-case scenario, it was ransacked by monster boys, who enslaved the previous owner while taking their home... best not to think about that one too much. Still, a home is a home. You grip your hammer tightly, prepared for the worst as the owner approaches the door...
13111.title: Knock on the cabin door.

choices: "What do you know about the candy monsters of the mountain?"
"Do you know any ways to defy monster feet?"
131112.content:
Opening the thick oak door is a satyr! A short, half-human half-goat monster boy! This one was slightly older with a mustache, you prepared your strike instinctively but the monster just cowered in fear. "Oh! Don't hurt me! I don't want a-anything to do with enslaving...or feet, see?" He pointed downwards, a pair of hooves. That checks out, you thought to yourself. You put your hammer down. "Well, you won't mind housing me for the night? I am on a righteous quest, and sleeping near the forest is dangerous." The satyr agreed and introduced himself. "I am Matthias. A human gave me this cabin in exchange for a song."

You raised an eyebrow at that. Matthias made you a bowl of modest porridge and you sat around the fire. "So you're a bard?" You ask him. He confirms this and gestures to his collection of instruments. "A satyr's song is the tool given to us by the Monster King, it is indeed powerful, and many pay good gold for it. The human who gave me this cabin wanted a song for his beloved in return." This monster seemed friendly. It would be a perfect opportunity to gain some information.
131112.title: It's a satyr!

choices: The house is attack suddenly and Matthias has disappeared
After a nice sleep, you get back to your journey
1311121.content: Seeing oppurtunitu, you decided to waste no time in asking your questions. "So...what can you tell me about the creatures along Candy Mountain?" The satyr shook his head as she sat by the fire himself. "Not too much I am afraid. I rarely go up towards that horrid place for my own good. The only thing worse to them than being a human is being a monster with no intention of foot enslavement. Besides, those sweet tooth seduces never use any dark chocolate. Never care about the health conscious, I mean sure thier candy is nutritious either way but still." You say nothing as Matthias folds his arms with an almost childish pout. It never occurred to you for a long time that monster boys could disagree with themselves. "Now, if you are going up there however there are two things I need to warm you about. The few times I watched those freaks, they try to portray themselves as giddy, dumb creatures but it is only an act. The second you're in thier grasp, that's when they become vicious. The Lollipop and Bubblegum boys especially lile to use that tactic. As an added problem, the few I see coming back down from this mountain are left happy and brainless themselves. Also, they seem to have become a lot more active recently. I have been hearing shouts and cheers from down in my cottage, they seem to have done something they're really proud of." "Like the capture of a princess?" You think to yourself. Your host pulls himself up and motions to a small couch in the corner. "I am sorry I don't have much more comfortable guest quarters. But who needs two of anything when they live alone? You thank the satyr and finish your porridge, ready to recuperate for the tough journey ahead. As the lights go out, you hear a strange roaring off in the distance. A roar filled with malice and feet power. No doubt the celebrating your were told about....
1311121.title: "What do you know about the candy monsters ...

choices: You manage to get the upper hand!
The Mallow Man gets the upper hand!
You get some of his mass in your mouth during the fight...
13111211.content:
You look around for your new friend, Matthias is already gone! You have a bad feeling about this, and you get back into your armour and get your trusty weapon. Peering from a window is a small group, five doughy white and pink boys, cheering with rock candy spears and light wafer armour. They had been dropped off by the the being that produced that mighty roar...a gummi dragon! It flies away and leave the s'more scouts to their mission, and they begin to move towards the house.

You grow frustrated, where did Matthias go? Did he set you up? Is he just a coward? At least these enemies seemed weak. Another peak from the window let you see the size of their feet, wide soles and toes, but long soles also. (-1 MP). They were crowding around the door now, which was unlocked as you remember. You crouch against the door, ready for a surprise. "Oh humaaan! We know who you are...and we know you just want to see our new princess! Very kind of you..just come with us and you'll-aah!" You refuse to be taken and kick down the door on top of him! (-4 HP!) You stomp on the door and keep him down! That takes care of one! However one of the scouts charges forward and nicks your shoulder with his spear! (-2 HP!)

This emboldens the others, and soon they're all at your throat! You manage to dodge a couple thrusts from the minty spears and take a direct swing at one of them with your two-handed hammer! (-4 HP!) He goes flying off in one direction! The final three nod at each other and jump into one another. They melt their bodies together to form one giant mallow man with a huge staff! You roll off the porch, not wanting to get trapped in the cabin, but now the giant is upon you! Every step wafted a sugary yet slightly sour smell your way. This fight just got tougher...

MP = 99
HP = 13/15

Mallow Man HP = 15/15
S'more Scout 1 HP = 1/5
S'more Scout 2 HP = 1/5
13111211.title: The house is attack suddenly and Matthias has d...

choices: The night goes on without incident.
1312.content:
On reflection, the dungeons were the most logical lead to take up first. After all, it held the thickest, most impenetrable defenses. On the other hand, the dungeons were the closest to the human territories, and the most difficult to transport the hostage out of. It depends on what they wanted with her. If it was just a blue-blooded brood sow they wanted, the dungeon was perfect. If they actually wanted to hold a ransom...probably not. You decide that the Monster Boys probably just want her as a slave they can brag about, and that you'll find her in the dungeon!

Of course, the entry to the dungeon is secret to humans. But you have a solution to that problem. With the help of the city guard, you've been allowed to keep a Monster Boy in your custody so he can guide you to the dungeon, he says he knows the way. A young Orcish boy by the name of Urtok. You keep him chained as you go, and you set up your map on the ground while you leave the confines of the gated city. "Alright Orc." You bark. "Where do we go first? There's still some light so we can start." The Orc smiles, despite being bossed around by a knight, it's better than prison! Also, he was being washed daily to prevent foot stink, so Urtok was looking forward to letting his feet grow smelly again...he wiggles his toes in excitement...and having the company of a strapping human was more than most monsters had. "South to the top of this hill." You follow his direction and soon arrive without any problems. "Good work, orc." Urtok doesn't mind being snubbed, especially as you take off your armor to sleep, revealing your body. "That's fine! Good night human." You both set up camp and go to sleep for the night to start the journey in full tomorrow.
1312.title: You go to the dungeons.

choices: Urtok takes you to the dungeon entrance.
Urtok just gets you lost deep in Monster Boy Territory!
13121.content:
Despite being within monster territory, the night goes uninterrupted by any nefarious soles. You slept lightly, due to the very rational fear of being taken in the night by monsters. And while Urtok's feet weren't quite smelly enough to be too threatening, he's still a monster. You get up and boil the pot for rations of porridge, as the water boils you go to the tree you chained the orc to, Urtok is up.

He's laying on the ground, rubbing his feet against a tree while grunting. The air is slightly stale, the monster's feet naturally sweat in large amounts. "What are you doing?" You say, you can't help but stare at this strange display as he rubs his large soft feet against the bark...(-1) Urtok smiles. "Haha...after months in your prison, my feet are getting used to walking out here...they're getting a little itchy! Could you...?" He raises his legs towards you, giving a perfect view of his soles which you turn away from. Too late of course, you caught sight of them, and it takes a second for you to banish such thoughts from your head. (-3)

The rest of the walk is only about 8 hours, the dungeon isn't too far away. Urtok looks at the map and informs you that the best way to it is through a forest path. And you allow him to take the lead through the undergrowth. As he walks ahead, you sometimes get flashes of his soles...and eight hours of that drains your MP by 3!

93/100 MP
13121.title: The night goes on without incident.

131211.content:
You set off early in the morning so you make it to the large stone complex in good time during the mid-afternoon. It's a moss covered, obscure place, and you find it hard to ascertain where the entrance is, Urtok watches you examine the dungeon with amusement, curious if you'd even need his help. You need his help. He chuckles before leading away. "Come Sir Summer...down here." He points down to a well a few metres away from the dungeon. "The dungeon has no doors, this is the only way in!" You give him a skeptical look...but you can't think of any other way in...you unshackle the orc. "Very well, you've earned your freedom. Thank you for your service, orc." You crouch against the well before diving into the darkness!

You hit the ground with a loud thud! Your armour protects you, and it was mostly soft mud you landed in...but still you take 1 damage! The dungeon is lit, there must be monsters in here! And hopefully the Princess...you unsheathe your sword and begin to creep through, when from the shadows a monster boy turns a corner to face you!
131211.title: Urtok takes you to the dungeon entrance.

1312112.content:
Around the corner comes a rather tall Anubis Warrior holding a large hammer in one hand. He's covered in thick black fur with only his chest, knees and crotch covered by old, steel armour. Ancient sandals cover his massive, filthy paws, they look ready to fall off! The stench of stale sweat fills your nose! (-2) The towering canine wiggles his toes in anticipation and looks down on you. "Well well well..." he snickers. "...a human in a can comes down to offer himself to his monster masters!" You ready your sword and get into a fighting stance! Your first Monster Boy fight! "Not quite fiend! I'm here to slay you and rescue the duchess's daughter!" The Anubis ignores your remarks about the princess. "Wrong! You're here to scrub my feet for eternity!" He lifts a foot, some of the sandal fabric at his sopping toes peeling away to reveal the ball of his wide, nasty paw. The fumes from his heated foot make you woozy. (-3) Still, you decide to strike with your sword!

MP = 88/100
Anubis Health = 8/8
1312112.title: A tall Anubis!

13121122.content:
The Anubis Warrior might be a little too jovial. He obviously doesn't see you as any kind of threat. He spins his hammer in his paw, clearly itching for a fight, you decide to give him exactly that! You swing back and push your warhammer into the air with all your might! You hear a sharp crack as the Anubis is slammed in the side, missing his ancient armor and hitting him square in the ribs! (-3 health!) The towering canine howls and stumbles to one side! "Aagh! You pathetic slime!" He recovers himself against the wall and stands back up.

He swings his hammer with great force, but you're in your element! You lift the hilt of your hammer and block the blow! You shake under the heft of the attack, but slide under and swing again, smashing his left thigh! (-2 health!) Anubis howls once more, whimpering slightly, and you gain some major confidence. "Yield to me monster!" He growls at you, you have him on the ropes now, and the Anubis roars. "Enough! I'll make you pay!" The Anubis....

MP = 88/100
Anubis Health = 3/8
13121122.title: Critical strike! (-3 Anubis Health!)

131211221.content:
You smirk as the Anubis loses his cool due to your onslaught. It looks like this dog is all bark and no bite! You raise your word to deliver the final strike... but for some reason, you stop dead in your tracks. A hushed whisper invades the silence of the chamber. You don't understand the tongue the Anubis is speaking in, but the words burrow straight into your mind. You feel extremely strange. (-10 MP)

While you're paralyzed, the Anubis sits on his behind, peels off his ancient sandals, and presents his bare feet to you! The odor invades your nasal passages, causing you to choke in his foul foot scent. Furthermore, he starts wiggling his clawed toes in a hypnotic motion. As you stare helplessly, your mind hazes with lust and your cock springs to life. (-5 MP)

The Anubis chuckles loudly. "Pathetic human! You may have a strong body, but your mind is weak! You fell victim to such a simple foot lust curse, and now you hunger for my feet, and the feet of my brethren!" You groan as your cock painfully presses at your pants, yearning to break free for the Anubis's furred feet. You desperately try and shake the thoughts from your mind. "R-Remove your vile feet from my sight, monster!"

To your surprise, the Anubis stands up and slides his sandals back on. "As you wish, human. But only I can dispel the curse. Accept your fate at the feet of superior monsterkind, or seek me out deeper into the chambers... if you dare." The Anubis mutters a few words under his breath, then disappears with a puff of smoke.

You groan as you continue deeper into the twisting labyrinth of the dungeon. All the while, images of the feet of monster boys flash through your head, impeding your progress and causing your stiff cock to throb. You think about how nice it would be to rub one out while worshiping a nice pair of monster boy feet... (-5 MP)

You're so distracted in your thoughts, you hardly notice your next foe approaching:

Your MP: 68/100
131211221.title: curses you!

1312112212.content:
All soldiers are given training of how what to do when captured, and more importantly, what to do when faced with a disgusting pair of feet that suddenly seem to become alluring. None of those psychological barriers were working for you right now. The curse is too strong, it makes all the lusty images near impossible to get out from your head! (-2 MP)

Not thinking properly, you turn a corner and bump your face into a muscled chest and a large clump of sweaty chest hair! You stumble back but a heavy fist already comes hurling from the body and slams you in the face! You dazedly fall back against the wall and lean against it, holding up your hammer threateningly. You now see your musky enemy.

A tall, muscular Minotaur with thick red fur and clompers half the size of Texas! Unlike the Anubis, the Minotaur proudly wanders the dungeons barefoot, his soles caked in sweat...but the sweat almost seems to be constant, leaving filthy and steaming footprints behind him with every step! The vinegary smell snakes into your nose. (-4 MP!) The Minotaur almost immediately notices your boner and steps forward while you're dazed!

"Guess you've already been visited by another one of my friends. But now I gotcha all to myself..." He rests his arm against a wall next to you and plucks your warhammer away. "...none of that little man! I'll tell ya what, I'll let you go if you listen to all my foot poems!" You looked down and he wiggled his toes...he chuckles as you are unable to stop looking for a moment. (-5 mp) "Whaddya say?"

Your MP: 57/100
Minotaur Health: 8/8
1312112212.title: A minotaur!

13121122121.content:
You watch in disbelief as your hammer flies from your hand! This Minotaur must have the strength of ten men! You guess that at least two of those men could be counted at his feet. Confused, horny and more than slightly intimidated, you nod in disbelief. He stares intently into your eyes and smiles. "Good man! Now why don't you lay at my feet while you listen?..." You know better, knowing looking at his feet would make you weak, nevermind lay at them. You'd be a slave in minutes! "I'd rather stand if it's all the same..." The minotaur paused in his merriment, but laughed and cleared his throat to begin his poem.

"I call this one "The Face in the Mud".

My tremendous feet have inspired masses
to have a new lease of life to each that passes.
One such example that makes me smile,
He was easy to beguile.
As I passed through a door
I saw a man buried in the floor!
Just his face was above the ground,
I'm sure his heart began to pound
when he saw my mighty soles,
but for me a new idea unfolds..."

Despite the droll and tired structure of a poem made of heroic couplets, your heart to begins to pound. Imagining being trapped in the floor at his muscular and stinking feet...was exciting! (-2MP)

"I stood above the damned fool
and raised my toes to make him drool,
I could smother and crush his mind,
but I slammed my foot down to his face's side!"

Again, despite a weak half rhyme at the end you can't help but listen. The minotaur keeps stamping rhythmically as he began his ode. (-2MP)

"With every stomp...his will was drained...
With every stomp...his pride less feigned
With every stomp...he begged for sweat...
With every stomp...and you're next I bet!"

The Minotaur finishes, but keeps stomping...each one feels like he's slowly squishing down on your brain, without thinking you're touching yourself...(-6MP!) "You can go now...unless you want another poem, champ..." He smirks...
13121122121.title: Listen to his poems.

choices: A figure walks in on you!
131211221212.content:
Your legs are weak, and your brain is fried, but a desperate plea from your rational mind just barely pierces through the rampant stamping and thick fog that obscures your rational mind. You must not fail your comrades! Do not give in; resist this despicable curse and live to fight another day!

You close your eyes and vigorously shake your head, temporarily dispelling the submissive trance you were in. Hoisting yourself off the ground and standing up straight, you look the smarmy Minotaur in the eyes, and triumphantly refuse his offer. His eyes widen. Clearly, he did not expect this sudden clarity from you. He stopped stamping his stompers and nodded his head, a nonverbal sign of agreement that you were free to go. He didn't even stop you when you swiped your warhammer from his fingers (which really wasn't the best idea; you nearly gave yourself a concussion when it missed your head by mere centimetres while you rested it on your shoulder).

While you shakily walked away, the bravado quickly fading from your mind, he called back to you, and you reluctantly turned your head. Luckily, you can tell by his upbeat expression that he isn't going to mess with you anymore--not that that stops every fibre of your being from telling you to throw yourself at his giant, sweat-slicked behemoths...

"I'm impressed, man! Most humans who get cursed by Addis fall right at the feet of any monster they come across. Tell you what; I'll give you an honest hint from the jackal himself," The Minotaur clears his throat and bellows out, loud and clear: "When the wicked fire dwindles, you may never find your way, for where one douses their own light is where one's sure to stay." He pauses, then cracks a smile. "Haha! That dork really loves his theatrics, you know. He spent a fortnight coming up with that one. Anyhow, I'll let you go this time, mister, uh...?"

"Summer. Sir Summer."

"Good to know. Don't lose your mind just yet, Sir Summer, you're pretty fun to mess with."

You give him a tired glare, which he waves off with a hearty chuckle. Sighing, you start walking away, adamant on continuing your search of the dungeon. If you escaped now, not only would you be failing your mission, you'd most likely live the rest of your life as a walking target for even the weakest and most pathetic of monster boys. You might've mustered up some courage this time, but you don't know how much more your mind can take before you start throwing yourself at the feet of anyone who passes you by.

The ambient light of the dungeon's cavernous chambers dims as you trot forward. You think back to the riddle the Minotaur gave you, but somehow you figure that it doesn't relate to these lights in particular. It's a riddle, after all; it's not supposed to be so literal. It's good food for thought, which helps you in your efforts to stave off your curse-bound desires.

You lunge towards the goblin, but before you can strange, he pulls out a strange device with a shiny red button on it. As he presses the button, a painful shock rocks your entire body, stopping you in your tracks! As the shock stops, you fall to your knees, groaning in pain.

"What, you really think I'm just gonna come in here defenseless? That collar strapped around your neck isn't just for looks. One press of this button, and you get punished. Now, stay down there on your knees like a good boy." You obey, not out of allegiance, but because it feels as if your joints locked up from the shock.

"Before you can see any clients, we have to make sure you're fit to serve under feet, and that the breaking process is as enjoyable to us as it is to you," the goblin explains as he makes his way to a luxurious red velvet couch. "I've been on my feet all day, and they're pretty sweaty, so I'm the perfect candidate for your first breaking." The goblin kicks his thick boots off and they land near your face. Just one sniff, and you can tell he wasn't bluffing. These things reek. You can almost see steam pouring out of them. (-5 MP) He stretches out his legs towards you, splays his stout green toes, and scrunches his sweaty soles, inviting you to come closer and take a whiff. (-5 MP) "Come on then, foot boy. Crawl over here to my feet and tell me how they smell... unless you wanna be punished again!" (-5 MP)

You're torn. On one hand, you really don't want to get any closer to his feet. Captured or not, you're still a proud knight! On the other, that was a very unpleasant shock, and you would do well to avoid such harm...

Your MP: 85/100
131222211.title: The Goblin wants to discipline you before you c...

choices: The raunchy Orc who had double crossed you.
A creature you've never seen before.
131222212.content:
Sneering with elated excitement to see you kidnapped, something about the Goblin's lewd glare brought another though to your mind, and you looked down, gasping as you realise all items of your clothing are no longer on your person.

"Ah yes, we've yet to prepare a proper uniform for you yet, haven't even had a collar picked out for you," he explained with utmost delight of seeing your naked body and going on about what more was to wait for him. "But not to worry, we'll soon take your measurements, but first, we have your introductory mind breaking session to attend to! And what luck it is, that we already have a client lined up who's just perfect for the stalwart mind of your 'calibre'."

You heard movement from the hall further down, the Goblin's grin growing more lecherous and sending shivers down your spine. "And I also have the delight of getting to watch as you submit, I need to see what your strongest and weakest points are after all, so we can correctly line you up with those who would so enjoy to level out your resistances... But for now, let me introduce you..."

Your first 'partner' comes into view...
131222212.title: He has a client waiting to be served!

132.content:
Dr. Kai (Not from a series...hope that's ok!)

MP: 100/100
Gold: 70
Inventory: handbow, potions, lotions, backpack, notebook, pen.

Dr.Kai is one of the most talented biologists in the whole world! A bookish but eccentric and determined young man. An expert in monster boys, he has been researching them for most of his short, 23 year old life. The cute blonde boy has been recently been funded by an anonymous benefactor to research the mind bending affects of monster feet. The patron has deep pockets, so this project has really swallowed his life, and it gives him a chance to interact with monster boys! He looked at his chart, he needed to collect a...
132.title: Boy!

choices: He will venture into the forest in search of an elf.
He plans an ambush on the elven general.
He figures out a way to get into the slave market.
1322.content:
The next item on Dr. Kai's list of research goals was a sample of elven foot sweat. He had hypothesised that the hypnotic effects of monster boy feet were caused by a foul-smelling and volatile substance secreted from between their toes; a substance which, if there was any truth to the rumours of adventurers falling into a trance after mere seconds of exposure to an elf's soles, should be found in high concentrations in their sweat. Sadly, from what Dr. Kai could piece together, elves would only sweat voluntarily. This meant that, if he wanted to get any decent sample, he would have to bring a live elf to his laboratory.

Of course, this was easier said than done... on one hand, elves weren't exactly hard to find - unlike most races of monster boys, elves were social beings who could live for thousands of years, seldom leaving their giant tree-cities. This meant that, once founded, elven colonies would rarely be abandoned. And fortunately for Dr. Kai, there was one such colony only a few miles north of his town.

At the same time, hunting down an elf, particularly in his natural habitat, was a dangerous proposition. Besides the aforementioned allure of elven feet, elves had an innate connection with the forest and its dwellers. Their cunning and agility was unmatched in all of the known races. Even with the help of experienced mercenaries, capturing an elf was a tall order indeed.

However, the same traits which made elves dangerous foes in their home country, also caused some of them to leave the forest and integrate the upper echelons on the Monster King's militia, as frightfully pungent warriors and generals. There were reports that an army of beast boys led by a elven marshwarden would soon pass by Dr. Kai's region on their way to besiege Antiuck. Assaulting the general's guard would require even more hired swords, but at least they would be fighting in roughly equal terms.

Aaand there was one last option... although the monster slavers would mostly trade in (more or less) foot-obsessed human beings, they would just as frequently sell other monster boys and girls. There was a good chance that if Dr. Kai were to infiltrate a monstrous slave market, he would be able to find a suitable subject for his experiments.

With those options in mind, Dr. Kai got busy planning the historically unprecedented capture of a living, breathing, stinking elf...
1322.title: ...an elf.

choices: Kai focuses on buying an elf.
He gets distracted by the potential magic.
13223.content:
Going into the forest alone was a dangerous way to go. And even if they captured a general, monster forces would be on them to destroy the experiment. Dr.Kai decided that buying an elf would be the safest bet, and probably cheaper than mercenaries anyway, covered by the cost of his benefactor. He was a aware of a monster slave market a few miles south in a large cave. And, the crafty wizard could cast a spell of mirage on himself to make his appearance more monstrous! It seemed perfect!

Kai had decided to take on the appearance of an Orc, they were common enough to be seen as normal but threatening enough to be left alone by anyone with ill intent. Once the spell was cast and money was collected, the mage began the southern walk to the cave, trying to keep to himself and not arouse any suspicion. The cave itself reeked of monsters, enough the make the doctor cough the moment he approached the gaping maw of the cave. (-1 mp). He entered, the initial muddy path breaking into the interior proper, a makeshift market lit by bug filled lanterns.

Hundreds of humans were being sold, glazed looks on their eyes for most, a minority looked frightened by their surroundings, and monsters hungrily eyed them and attached chains to their new purchases. Other stalls held magics and artifacts of power that Kai had never seen or heard about before! The other stalls seemed trivial, to him at least. The footwear peddlers always had customers eager to buy, it seemed, and so did monsters shilling out strange devices made to torture feckless humans.
13223.title: He figures out a way to get into the slave market.

132232.content:
Dr. Kai would happily recognise that he mastered only a small fraction of human magic; but he literally had zero knowledge of monster boy magic! The prospect of learning more about those dark and forbidden arts had him immediately enthralled. Completely forgetting his mission, Kai happily wandered off into the sea of magical stalls.

One merchant in particular caught his attention. It was a tall, red-skinned lizardman, whose hissing voice stood out from the rest of the yelling salesmen: "Ringssss of Tracking! Orbssss of Confusion! Chainssss of Sssubmission! Unleash your true foot ssscent with our patented Troll Ssspice perfume... fine Landrakkian craftssssmanship! Quality productsss at affordable pricesss..."

Landrakkian? Could it be true?! Kai pushed his way through the crowd, an easy task when he disguised as an orc, and arrived at the lizardman's stall. He looked at the elegant, horned figure before him, and he could barely believe what he was seeing: a true, breathing landrake! He had only heard of the dragon-human hybrid in legends, he had never presumed them to be real! A humanoid creature combining the inborn magical skills of a drake with the shrewd industriousness of mankind...

"What an honour, sir!" Kai mumbled to the merchant, vigorously shaking his hand, clearly not realising how strange his behaviour was for a supposed monster boy.

"T-thank you, my dear gentleman..." the landrake muttered in response, trying to be polite. "Feel free to browse my waressss..."

Dr. Kai's gaze was suddenly torn from the biological miracle before him, and to a table which was filled with most various and wonderful trinkets he had ever seen. Simple pieces of jewellery and orbs, clearly imbued with powerful dragon enchantments, and complex machines whose function he could only guess was to help destroy human minds and bind them to the will of their new masters... books, potions, weapons... it was hard to pick one mysterious item to bring home. Because, of course, it was only fair he bought something to support such an endangered species...

MP: 99/100
132232.title: He gets distracted by the potential magic.

1451.content: Now that we have our series all nice and picked out, who shall be the 'victim' for our foot-based journey through Hyrule?
1451.title: Legend of Zelda

14511.content: The Princess of the Zoras (at least in the Ocarina of Time), now the question we need to establish before we finally get to work is this: Are we going with the more battle ready Hyrule Warriors version with her Zora scale or the not so battle ready variant?
14511.title: Ruto

145112.content:
Lana looked to the orbs floating about her in curiosity. While her powers were mostly over surveying time, she had the ability to look into other worlds as well as timelines. Throughout her observations, she had come across a few strange versions of Hyrule.Taking a look into another orb, Lana decided to focus her vision on this world's version of the Zoran Princess.

The cold water of her surroundings did nothing to deter Ruto as she swam through the submerged gate, she needed time to think over the problem at hand. As she rose over the surface into the temple grotto, Ruto took comfort in the quiet echoes all around her. After a few deep breaths, she sat down in thought. For as long as she could remember, monstrous being plagued the lands of Hyrule and it's people. These monsters however seemed to have a rather odd fascination with feet and an even worse habit of dominating others with them. Of course the Zora' s and a few other civilization didn't have too much trouble when they themselves weren't truly human. However, it was for that same reason that the Hyailns became more and more isolated. After years of near quiet, Princess Zelda had reached out to the Queen and therefore herself with the claim she had a way to end this madness. The problem itself being that Ruto' s mother would not be able to make the journey and so the trip was upon the princesses shoulders. Sure she had been outside before, but she really only stayed to the rivers and even then barely left the domain of her subjects. As Ruto stayed in thought, she was unaware of what was watching her in the darkness. She finally did become aware when the most rancid oder assaulted her nose. "Oh disgusting. Who dares being such an uncouth scent to...." Ruto stopped in her tracks and her sentence as she looked at what stood before her.
145112.title: Princess Ruto

info.brief_description: Get dominated by monster boys and their feet!
info.description:
This is a pseudo-spinoff of my other interactive story, Monster Girl Feet. Check it out here: http://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/2097160-Monster-Girl-Feet

Thanks to demand, I've decided to write a story about monster boys. Not just any monster boys, mind you, ones who love to fight humans and tease and humiliate them with their feet! You can choose to be a boy or a girl, or a character from a different series (i.e. Naruto, Hunter x Hunter, Avatar, etc). Also, instead of having a pre-decided age and backstory for the main characters, you can choose one!

Also, calato gave me the excellent idea of using an RPG-ish system. Characters have MP, gold, and an inventory. The MP stands for mind points, and as they're attacked/teased by a monster boy's feet, their MP drops, and they slowly start enjoying being dominated by the monster boy's feet.

"The hero will have 100 MP

Why did I choose 100 mind points?

Because I want the hero to start to think differently as he loses MP.

If he/she loses 1/4 of his MP or more (75 MP remaining or less), he/she'll realize monster boy's feet (cute monsters' feet) are not bad.

If he/she loses 1/2 of his MP or more (50 MP remaining or less), he/she'll literally LOVE cute monsters' feet and will start to like uglier monsters' feet.

If he/she loses 3/4 of his MP or more (25 MP remaining or less), then he/she'll love cute monsters' feet even more and will also love uglier monsters' feet a lot.

If his/her MP reach 0 then ... asolute slavery for all possible monsters' feet no matter who they're are ... only a miracle can save him/her from eternal foot slavery ^^."

"About the battle system, I thought of something like.

if our hero attacks, her basc attack is 1 + 1 for a her steel rod. Which means she will deal 2 dmgs. If the enemy has an armor of 0 he'll take 2 dmgs, if his armor is 1 he'll reduce dmg by 1 and will receive only 1 dmg.

Same goes for her: but since she has basic clothes her armor should be 0 so she'll receive maybe 5 dmgs from the goblin."

RULES:
-No female feet. I made another story for that, remember? :P (ADDENDUM: After thinking about just how much I like both, and how making a "Monster Girl + Boy Feet" would be a needless split, I've decided to allow SOME female feet involved. HOWEVER, monster boy feet are to always be at the front and center, and a scene cannot feature female feet without also having a strong focus on male feet. For example, a scene where a monster boy and his monster girl mate both use their stinky feet to enslave an adventurer would be okay. A scene where that monster girl dominates with no input from her mate is unacceptable. If this rule serves to be particularly controversial, I will strike it down immediately. I just want to try this out for now.)
-Shrinking, hypnosis, transformation, and dirt/sweat are allowed and encouraged.
-Watersports and scat are NOT allowed
-Anything you want to write about that aren’t on those lists? Shoot me a PM first just to be sure.
-You have to use proper grammar and spelling..
-All non-choice chapters need to be at least a paragraph long.
-Feel free to go crazy with monsters! Anything from plain elves, to bulky orcs, to huge dragons are okay with me!

Have fun!
